   20: 
   21: -module(port_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%%
   24: %%% Author: Bjorn Gustavsson; iter_max_ports contributed by Peter Hogfeldt.
   25: %%%
   26: 
   27: %%
   28: %% There are a lot of things to test with open_port(Name, Settings).
   29: %%
   30: %%   Name can be
   31: %%
   32: %%       {spawn, Command}
   33: %%         which according to The Book and the manual page starts an
   34: %%         external program. That is not true. It might very well be
   35: %%         a linked-in program (the notion of 'linked-in driver' is
   36: %%         silly, since any driver is 'linked-in').
   37: %%	  [Spawn of external program is tested.]
   38: %%
   39: %%       Atom
   40: %%         Read all contents of Atom, or write to it.
   41: %%
   42: %%       {fd, In, Out}
   43: %%       Open file descriptors In and Out. [Not tested]
   44: %%
   45: %%   PortSettings can be
   46: %%
   47: %%       {packet, N}
   48: %%         N is 1, 2 or 4.
   49: %%
   50: %%       stream (default)
   51: %%         Without packet length.
   52: %%
   53: %%       use_stdio (default for spawned ports)
   54: %%         The spawned process use file descriptors 0 and 1 for I/O.
   55: %%
   56: %%       nouse_stdio					[Not tested]
   57: %%         Use filedescriptors 3 and 4.  This option is probably only
   58: %%	   meaningful on Unix.
   59: %%
   60: %%       in (default for Atom)
   61: %%         Input only (from Erlang's point of view).
   62: %%
   63: %%       out
   64: %%         Output only (from Erlang's point of view).
   65: %%
   66: %%       binary
   67: %%         The port is a binary port, i.e. messages received and sent
   68: %%         to a port are binaries.
   69: %%
   70: %%       eof
   71: %%         Port is not closed on eof and will not send an exit signal,
   72: %%         instead it will send a {Port, eof} to the controlling process
   73: %%         (output can still be sent to the port (??)).
   74: %%
   75: 
   76: 
   77: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   78:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   79: -export([
   80:     bad_args/1,
   81:     bad_env/1,
   82:     bad_packet/1,
   83:     bad_port_messages/1,
   84:     basic_ping/1,

   87:     close_deaf_port/1,
   88:     count_fds/1,
   89:     dropped_commands/1,
   90:     dying_port/1,
   91:     env/1,
   92:     eof/1,
   93:     exit_status/1,
   94:     exit_status_multi_scheduling_block/1,
   95:     huge_env/1,
   96:     pipe_limit_env/1,
   97:     input_only/1,
   98:     iter_max_ports/1,
   99:     line/1,

  101:     mon_port_invalid_type/1,
  102:     mon_port_bad_named/1,
  103:     mon_port_bad_remote_on_local/1,
  104:     mon_port_local/1,
  105:     mon_port_name_demonitor/1,
  106:     mon_port_named/1,
  107:     mon_port_origin_dies/1,
  108:     mon_port_owner_dies/1,
  109:     mon_port_pid_demonitor/1,
  110:     mon_port_remote_on_remote/1,
  111:     mon_port_driver_die/1,
  112:     mul_basic/1,
  113:     mul_slow_writes/1,
  114:     name1/1,
  115:     open_input_file_port/1,

  117:     otp_3906/1,

  123:     parallelism_option/1,
  124:     parallell/1,

  126:     port_setget_data/1,
  127:     ports/1,
  128:     slow_writes/1,

  141: ]).

  144:          port_exit_demonitor_race/1,

  169: suite() ->
  170:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  171:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
  172: 
  173: all() ->
  174:     [otp_6224, {group, stream}, basic_ping, slow_writes,
  175:      bad_packet, bad_port_messages, {group, options},
  176:      {group, multiple_packets}, parallell, dying_port, dropped_commands,
  177:      port_program_with_path, open_input_file_port,
  178:      open_output_file_port, name1, env, huge_env, bad_env, cd,
  179:      cd_relative, pipe_limit_env, bad_args,

  183:      exit_status_multi_scheduling_block, ports, spawn_driver,
  184:      spawn_executable, close_deaf_port, unregister_name,
  185:      port_setget_data,

  191:      mon_port_origin_dies,
  192:      mon_port_owner_dies,
  193:      mon_port_named,
  194:      mon_port_bad_named,
  195:      mon_port_pid_demonitor,
  196:      mon_port_name_demonitor,
  197:      mon_port_driver_die,
  198:      {group, port_exit_signal_race}].
  199: 
  200: groups() ->
  201:     [{stream, [], [stream_small, stream_big]},
  202:      {options, [], [t_binary, eof, input_only, output_only]},
  203:      {multiple_packets, [], [mul_basic, mul_slow_writes]},
  204:      {tps, [], [tps_16_bytes, tps_1K]},
  205:      {port_exit_signal_race, [], [port_exit_monitor_race,
  206:                                   port_exit_demonitor_race,
  207:                                   port_exit_link_race,
  208:                                   port_exit_unlink_race,
  209:                                   port_exit_command_race,
  210:                                   port_exit_connect_race,
  211:                                   port_exit_close_race,
  212:                                   port_exit_exit_race,
  213:                                   port_exit_command_request_race,
  214:                                   port_exit_connect_request_race,
  215:                                   port_exit_close_request_race,
  216:                                   port_exit_control_request_race,
  217:                                   port_exit_call_request_race,
  218:                                   port_exit_info_request_race]}].
  219: 
  220: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case =:= mon_port_driver_die;
  221:                                      Case =:= mon_port_driver_die_demonitor ->
  222:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  223:         1 -> {skip, "Need 2 schedulers to run testcase"};
  224:         _ -> Config
  225:     end;
  226: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  227:     [{testcase, Case} |Config].
  228: 
  229: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  230:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  231: 
  232: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     ignore_cores:init(Config).
  234: 
  235: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     ignore_cores:fini(Config).
  237: 
  238: 
  239: -define(WIN_MASSIVE_PORT, 50000).
  240: 
  241: %% Tests that you can open a massive amount of ports (sockets)
  242: %% on a Windows machine given the correct environment.
  243: win_massive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     case os:type() of
  245:         {win32,_} ->
  246:             do_win_massive();
  247:         _ ->
  248:             {skip,"Only on Windows."}
  249:     end.
  250: 
  251: do_win_massive() ->
  252:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 6}),
  253:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "8192"]),
  254:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,win_massive_client,[3000]),
  255:     peer:stop(Peer).
  256: 
  257: win_massive_client(N) ->
  258:     {ok,P}=gen_tcp:listen(?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[{reuseaddr,true}]),
  259:     L = win_massive_loop(P,N),
  260:     Len = length(L),
  261:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
  262:                           gen_tcp:close(E)
  263:                   end,
  264:                   L),
  265:     case Len div 2 of
  266:         N ->
  267:             ok;
  268:         _Else ->
  269:             {too_few, Len}
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: win_massive_loop(_,0) ->
  273:     [];
  274: win_massive_loop(P,N) ->
  275:     case (catch gen_tcp:connect("localhost",?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[])) of
  276:         {ok,A} ->
  277:             case (catch gen_tcp:accept(P)) of
  278:                 {ok,B} ->
  279:                     %erlang:display(N),
  280:                     [A,B|win_massive_loop(P,N-1)];
  281:                 _Else ->
  282:                     [A]
  283:             end;
  284:         _Else0 ->
  285:             []
  286:     end.
  287: 
  288: 
  289: %% Test that we can send a stream of bytes and get it back.
  290: %% We will send only a small amount of data, to avoid deadlock.
  291: 
  292: stream_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     stream_ping(Config, 512, "", []),
  294:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "", []),
  295:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "-s512", []),
  296:     ok.
  297: 
  298: %% Send big amounts of data (much bigger than the buffer size in port test).
  299: %% This will deadlock the emulator if the spawn driver haven't proper
  300: %% non-blocking reads and writes.
  301: 
  302: stream_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  303:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 180}),
  304:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", []),
  305:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", []),
  306:     stream_ping(Config, 77777, " -s40000", []),
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: %% Sends packet with header size of 1, 2, and 4, with packets of various
  310: %% sizes.
  311: 
  312: basic_ping(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  313:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  314:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", []),
  315:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", []),
  316:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", []),
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: %% Let the port program insert delays between characters sent back to
  320: %% Erlang, to test that the Erlang emulator can handle a packet coming in
  321: %% small chunks rather than all at once.
  322: 
  323: slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     ping(Config, [8], 4, "-s1", []),
  325:     ping(Config, [10], 2, "-s2", []),
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: %% Test that we get {'EXIT', Port, einval} if we try to send a bigger
  329: %% packet than the packet header allows.
  330: bad_packet(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  331:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  332:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  333: 
  334:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 256),
  335:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 257),
  336:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65536),
  337:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65537),
  338:     ok.
  339: 
  340: bad_packet(PortTest, HeaderSize, PacketSize) ->
  341:     P = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [{packet, HeaderSize}]),
  342:     P ! {self(), {command, make_zero_packet(PacketSize)}},
  343:     receive
  344:         {'EXIT', P, einval} -> ok;
  345:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  346:     end.
  347: 
  348: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
  349: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
  350:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  351:     [P|P];
  352: make_zero_packet(N) ->
  353:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  354:     [0, P|P].
  355: 
  356: %% Test sending bad messages to a port.
  357: bad_port_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  358:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  359:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  360: 
  361:     bad_message(PortTest, {a,b}),
  362:     bad_message(PortTest, {a}),
  363:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{command,bad_command}}),
  364:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{connect,no_pid}}),
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: bad_message(PortTest, Message) ->
  368:     P = open_port({spawn,PortTest}, []),
  369:     P ! Message,
  370:     receive
  371:         {'EXIT',P,badsig} -> ok;
  372:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  373:     end.
  374: 
  375: %% Tests various options (stream and {packet, Number} are implicitly
  376: %% tested in other test cases).
  377: 
  378: 
  379: %% Tests the 'binary' option for a port.
  380: 
  381: t_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  383: 
  384:     %% Packet mode.
  385:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", [binary]),
  386:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", [binary]),
  387:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", [binary]),
  388: 
  389:     %% Stream mode.
  390:     stream_ping(Config, 435, "", [binary]),
  391:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", [binary]),
  392:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", [binary]),
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: name1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  396:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  397:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  398:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " "]),
  399:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, []),
  400:     register(myport, P),
  401:     P = whereis(myport),
  402:     Text = "hej",
  403:     myport ! {self(), {command, Text}},
  404:     receive
  405:         {P, {data, Text}} ->
  406:             ok
  407:     end,
  408:     myport ! {self(), close},
  409:     receive
  410:         {P, closed} -> ok
  411:     end,
  412:     undefined = whereis(myport),
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: %% Test that the 'eof' option works.
  416: 
  417: eof(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  419:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  420:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  421:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  422:     receive
  423:         {P, eof} ->
  424:             ok
  425:     end,
  426:     P ! {self(), close},
  427:     receive
  428:         {P, closed} -> ok
  429:     end,
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: %% Tests that the 'in' option for a port works.
  433: 
  434: input_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  436:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255], 1, "", [in]),
  437:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 2, "", [in]),
  438:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 4, "", [in]),
  439:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255],
  440:                  1, "", [in, binary]),
  441:     ok.
  442: 
  443: %% Tests that the 'out' option for a port works.
  444: 
  445: output_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  446:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  447:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  448: 
  449:     %% First we test that the port program gets the data
  450:     Filename = filename:join(Dir, "output_only_stream"),
  451:     Data = random_packet(35777, "echo"),
  452:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0 -o", Filename], Data),
  453:     Wait_time = 500,
  454:     test_server:sleep(Wait_time),
  455:     {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  456:     Data = binary_to_list(Written),
  457: 
  458:     %% Then we test that any writes to stdout from
  459:     %% the port program is not sent to erlang
  460:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0"], Data),
  461:     ok.
  462: 
  463: output_and_verify(Config, Options, Data) ->
  464:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  465:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " " | Options]),
  466:     Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, [out]),
  467:     Port ! {self(), {command, Data}},
  468:     Port ! {self(), close},
  469:     receive
  470:         {Port, closed} -> ok;
  471:         Msg -> ct:fail({received_unexpected_message, Msg})
  472:     end.
  473: 
  474: %% Test that receiving several packages written in the same
  475: %% write operation works.
  476: 
  477: 
  478: %% Basic test of receiving multiple packages, written in
  479: %% one operation by the other end.
  480: mul_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  481:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  482:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 10, 13], 1, "", []),
  483:     expect_input(Config, [0, 10, 13, 1600, 32767, 65535], 2, "", []),
  484:     expect_input(Config, [10, 70000], 4, "", []),
  485:     ok.
  486: 
  487: %% Test reading a buffer consisting of several packets, some
  488: %% of which might be incomplete.  (The port program builds
  489: %% a buffer with several packets, but writes it in chunks with
  490: %% delays in between.)
  491: 
  492: mul_slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  493:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
  494:     expect_input(Config, [0, 20, 255, 10, 1], 1, "-s64", []),
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: %% Runs several port tests in parallell.  Each individual test
  498: %% finishes in about 5 seconds.  Running in parallell, all tests
  499: %% should also finish in about 5 seconds.
  500: 
  501: parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  502:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  503:     Testers = [
  504:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 1007, "-s100", []) end,
  505:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  506:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  507: 
  508:                fun() -> expect_input(Config, [21, 22, 23, 24, 25], 1,
  509:                                      "-s10", [in]) end,
  510: 
  511:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10], 1, "-d", []) end,
  512:                fun() -> ping(Config, [20000], 2, "-d", []) end,
  513:                fun() -> ping(Config, [101], 1, "-s10", []) end,
  514:                fun() -> ping(Config, [1001], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  515:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10001], 4, "-s1000", []) end,
  516: 
  517:                fun() -> ping(Config, [501, 501], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  518:                fun() -> ping(Config, [11, 12, 13, 14, 11], 1, "-s5", []) end],
  519:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  520:     Pids = lists:map(fun fun_spawn/1, Testers),
  521:     wait_for(Pids),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: wait_for([]) ->
  525:     ok;
  526: wait_for(Pids) ->
  527:     io:format("Waiting for ~p", [Pids]),
  528:     receive
  529:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  530:             wait_for(lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  531:         Other ->
  532:             ct:fail({bad_exit, Other})
  533:     end.
  534: 
  535: %% Tests starting port programs that terminate by themselves.
  536: %% This used to cause problems on Windows.
  537: 
  538: dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  539:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  540:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  541: 
  542:     P1 = make_dying_port(Config),
  543:     P2 = make_dying_port(Config),
  544:     P3 = make_dying_port(Config),
  545:     P4 = make_dying_port(Config),
  546:     P5 = make_dying_port(Config),
  547: 
  548:     %% This should be big enough to be sure to block in the write.
  549:     Garbage = random_packet(16384),
  550: 
  551:     P1 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  552:     P3 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  553:     P5 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  554: 
  555:     wait_for_port_exit(P1),
  556:     wait_for_port_exit(P2),
  557:     wait_for_port_exit(P3),
  558:     wait_for_port_exit(P4),
  559:     wait_for_port_exit(P5),
  560:     ok.
  561: 
  562: wait_for_port_exit(Port) ->
  563:     receive
  564:         {'EXIT', Port, _} ->
  565:             ok
  566:     end.
  567: 
  568: make_dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  569:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  570:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -d -q"]),
  571:     open_port({spawn, Command}, [stream]).
  572: 
  573: %% Test that dropped port_commands work correctly.
  574: %% This used to cause a segfault.
  575: %%
  576: %% This testcase creates a port and then lets many processes
  577: %% do parallel commands to it. After a while it closes the
  578: %% port and we are trying to catch the race when doing a
  579: %% command while the port is closing.
  580: dropped_commands(Config) ->
  581:     %% Test with output callback
  582:     dropped_commands(Config, false, {self(), {command, "1"}}),
  583:     %% Test with outputv callback
  584:     dropped_commands(Config, true, {self(), {command, "1"}}).
  585: 
  586: dropped_commands(Config, Outputv, Cmd) ->
  587:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  588:     os:putenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV", atom_to_list(Outputv)),
  589:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
  590:     [dropped_commands_test(Cmd) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  591:     timer:sleep(100),
  592:     erl_ddll:unload_driver("echo_drv"),
  593:     os:unsetenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV"),
  594:     ok.
  595: 
  596: dropped_commands_test(Cmd) ->
  597:     spawn_monitor(
  598:       fun() ->
  599:               Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
  600:                                       [{parallelism, true}]),
  601:               [spawn_link(fun() -> spin(Port, Cmd) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1,8)],
  602:               timer:sleep(5),
  603:               port_close(Port),
  604:               timer:sleep(5),
  605:               exit(nok)
  606:       end),
  607:     receive _M -> timer:sleep(5) end.
  608: 
  609: spin(P, Cmd) ->
  610:     P ! Cmd,
  611:     spin(P, Cmd).
  612: 
  613: 
  614: %% Tests that port program with complete path (but without any
  615: %% .exe extension) can be started, even if there is a file with
  616: %% the same name but without the extension in the same directory.
  617: %% (In practice, the file with the same name could be a Unix
  618: %% executable.)
  619: %%
  620: %% This used to failed on Windows (the .exe extension had to be
  621: %% explicitly given).
  622: %%
  623: %% This testcase works on Unix, but is not very useful.
  624: 
  625: port_program_with_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  626:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  627:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  628:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  629: 
  630:     %% Create a copy of the port test program in a directory not
  631:     %% included in PATH (i.e. in priv_dir), with the name 'my_port_test.exe'.
  632:     %% Also, place a file named 'my_port_test' in the same directory.
  633:     %% This used to confuse the CreateProcess() call in spawn driver.
  634:     %% (On Unix, there will be a single file created, which will be
  635:     %% a copy of the port program.)
  636: 
  637:     PortTest = os:find_executable("port_test", DataDir),
  638:     io:format("os:find_executable(~p, ~p) returned ~p",
  639:               ["port_test", DataDir, PortTest]),
  640:     {ok, PortTestPgm} = file:read_file(PortTest),
  641:     NewName = filename:join(PrivDir, filename:basename(PortTest)),
  642:     RedHerring = filename:rootname(NewName),
  643:     ok = file:write_file(RedHerring, "I'm just here to confuse.\n"),
  644:     ok = file:write_file(NewName, PortTestPgm),
  645:     ok = file:write_file_info(NewName, #file_info{mode=8#111}),
  646:     PgmWithPathAndNoExt = filename:rootname(NewName),
  647: 
  648:     %% Open the port using the path to the copied port test program,
  649:     %% but without the .exe extension, and verified that it was started.
  650:     %%
  651:     %% If the bug is present the open_port call will fail with badarg.
  652: 
  653:     Command = lists:concat([PgmWithPathAndNoExt, " -h2"]),
  654:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [{packet, 2}]),
  655:     Message = "echo back to me",
  656:     P ! {self(), {command, Message}},
  657:     receive
  658:         {P, {data, Message}} ->
  659:             ok
  660:     end,
  661:     ok.
  662: 
  663: 
  664: %% Tests that files can be read using open_port(Filename, [in]).
  665: %% This used to fail on Windows.
  666: open_input_file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  667:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  668: 
  669:     %% Create a file with the file driver and read it back using
  670:     %% open_port/2.
  671: 
  672:     MyFile1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_input_file"),
  673:     FileData1 = "An input file",
  674:     ok = file:write_file(MyFile1, FileData1),
  675:     case open_port(MyFile1, [in]) of
  676:         InputPort when is_port(InputPort) ->
  677:             receive
  678:                 {InputPort, {data, FileData1}} ->
  679:                     ok
  680:             end
  681:     end,
  682:     ok.
  683: 
  684: %% Tests that files can be written using open_port(Filename, [out]).
  685: open_output_file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  686:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  687:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  688: 
  689:     %% Create a file with open_port/2 and read it back with
  690:     %% the file driver.
  691: 
  692:     MyFile2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_output_file"),
  693:     FileData2_0 = "A file created ",
  694:     FileData2_1 = "with open_port/2.\n",
  695:     FileData2 = FileData2_0 ++ FileData2_1,
  696:     OutputPort = open_port(MyFile2, [out]),
  697:     OutputPort ! {self(), {command, FileData2_0}},
  698:     OutputPort ! {self(), {command, FileData2_1}},
  699:     OutputPort ! {self(), close},
  700:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(MyFile2),
  701:     FileData2 = binary_to_list(Bin),
  702:     ok.
  703: 
  704: %% Tests that all appropriate fd's have been closed in the port program
  705: count_fds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  706:     case os:type() of
  707:         {unix, _} ->
  708:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  709:             Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_fd_counter"),
  710: 
  711:             RunTest = fun(PortOpts) ->
  712:                               PortTest = port_test(Config),
  713:                               Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -n -f -o", Filename]),
  714:                               Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, PortOpts),
  715:                               Port ! {self(), close},
  716:                               receive
  717:                                   {Port, closed} -> ok
  718:                               end,
  719:                               test_server:sleep(500),
  720:                               {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  721:                               Written
  722:                       end,
  723:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([out, nouse_stdio]),
  724:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([in, nouse_stdio]),
  725:             <<5:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, nouse_stdio]),
  726:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio]),
  727:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, use_stdio]),
  728:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio]),
  729:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  730:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]);
  731:         _ ->
  732:             {skip, "Skipped on windows"}
  733:     end.
  734: 
  735: %%
  736: %% Open as many ports as possible. Do this several times and check
  737: %% that we get the same number of ports every time.
  738: %%
  739: 
  740: iter_max_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  741:     %% The child_setup program might dump core if we get out of memory.
  742:     %% This is hard to do anything about and is harmless. We run this test
  743:     %% in a working directory with an ignore_core_files file which will make
  744:     %% the search for core files ignore cores generated by this test.
  745:     %%
  746:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, iter_max_ports, Config, true),
  747:     try
  748:         iter_max_ports_test(Config2)
  749:     after
  750:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  751:     end.
  752: 
  753: 
  754: iter_max_ports_test(Config) ->
  755:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 30}),
  756:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  757:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  758:     Iters = case os:type() of
  759:                 {win32,_} -> 4;
  760:                 _ -> 10
  761:             end,
  762:     %% Run on a different node in order to limit the effect if this test fails.
  763:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "2048"]),
  764:     L = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_iter_max_ports,[Iters, Command]),
  765:     peer:stop(Peer),
  766: 
  767:     ct:log("Result: ~p",[L]),
  768:     all_equal(L),
  769:     all_equal(L),
  770:     {comment, "Max ports: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
  771: 
  772: do_iter_max_ports(N, Command) when N > 0 ->
  773:     [max_ports(Command)| do_iter_max_ports(N-1, Command)];
  774: do_iter_max_ports(_, _) ->
  775:     [].
  776: 
  777: all_equal([E,E|T]) ->
  778:     all_equal([E|T]);
  779: all_equal([_]) -> ok;
  780: all_equal([]) -> ok.
  781: 
  782: max_ports(Command) ->
  783:     test_server:sleep(500),
  784:     Ps = open_ports({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  785:     N = length(Ps),
  786:     close_ports(Ps),
  787:     io:format("Got ~p ports\n",[N]),
  788:     N.
  789: 
  790: close_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  791:     P ! {self(), close},
  792:     receive
  793:         {P,closed} ->
  794:             ok
  795:     end,
  796:     close_ports(Ps);
  797: close_ports([]) ->
  798:     ok.
  799: 
  800: open_ports(Name, Settings) ->
  801:     case os:type() of
  802:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  803:             %% FreeBsd has issues with sendmsg/recvmsg in fork
  804:             %% implementation and we therefore have to spawn
  805:             %% slower to make sure that we always hit the same
  806:             %% make roof.
  807:             test_server:sleep(10);
  808:         _ ->
  809:             test_server:sleep(5)
  810:     end,
  811:     case catch open_port(Name, Settings) of
  812:         P when is_port(P) ->
  813:             [P| open_ports(Name, Settings)];
  814:         {'EXIT', {Code, _}} ->
  815:             case Code of
  816:                 enfile ->
  817:                     [];
  818:                 emfile ->
  819:                     [];
  820:                 system_limit ->
  821:                     [];
  822:                 enomem ->
  823:                     [];
  824:                 Other ->
  825:                     ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  826:             end;
  827:         Other ->
  828:             ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  829:     end.
  830: 
  831: %% Tests that exit(Port, Term) works (has been known to crash the emulator).
  832: 
  833: t_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  834:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  835:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun suicide_port/1, [Config]),
  836:     receive
  837:         {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  838:             ok;
  839:         Other ->
  840:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  841:     end.
  842: 
  843: suicide_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  844:     Port = port_expect(Config, [], 0, "", []),
  845:     exit(Port, die),
  846:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
  847: 
  848: 
  849: tps_16_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850:     tps(16, Config).
  851: 
  852: tps_1K(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  853:     tps(1024, Config).
  854: 
  855: tps(Size, Config) ->
  856:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  857:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  858:     Packet = list_to_binary(random_packet(Size, "e")),
  859:     Port = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [binary, {packet, 2}]),
  860:     Transactions = 10000,
  861:     {Elapsed, ok} = test_server:timecall(?MODULE, tps,
  862:                                          [Port, Packet, Transactions]),
  863:     {comment, integer_to_list(trunc(Transactions/Elapsed+0.5)) ++ " transactions/s"}.
  864: 
  865: tps(_Port, _Packet, 0) -> ok;
  866: tps(Port, Packet, N) ->
  867:     port_command(Port, Packet),
  868:     receive
  869:         {Port, {data, Packet}} ->
  870:             tps(Port, Packet, N-1);
  871:         Other ->
  872:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  873:     end.
  874: 
  875: %% Line I/O test
  876: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  877:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  878:     Siz = 110,
  879:     Packet1 = random_packet(Siz),
  880:     Packet2 = random_packet(Siz div 2),
  881:     %% Test that packets are split into lines
  882:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  883:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  884:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  885:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  886:     %% Test the same for binaries
  887:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  888:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  889:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  890:                 0, "", [{line,Siz},binary]),
  891:     %% Test that too long lines get split
  892:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet1,
  893:                                        Packet2, io_lib:nl()]),
  894:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet1},
  895:                           {eol, Packet2}]}], 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  896:     %% Test that last output from closing port program gets received.
  897:     L1 = lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2]),
  898:     S1 = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("-l~w", [length(L1)])),
  899:     io:format("S1 = ~w, L1 = ~w~n", [S1,L1]),
  900:     port_expect(Config,[{L1,
  901:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet2}, eof]}], 0,
  902:                 S1, [{line,Siz},eof]),
  903:     %% Test that lonely <CR> Don't get treated as newlines
  904:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, [13], Packet2,
  905:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  906:                          [{noeol, Packet1}, {eol, [13 |Packet2]}]}],
  907:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  908:     %% Test that packets get built up to lines (delayed output from
  909:     %% port program)
  910:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet2,[]},
  911:                         {lists:append([Packet2, io_lib:nl(),
  912:                                        Packet1, io_lib:nl()]),
  913:                          [{eol, lists:append(Packet2, Packet2)},
  914:                           {eol, Packet1}]}], 0, "-d", [{line,Siz}]),
  915:     %% Test that we get badarg if trying both packet and line
  916:     bad_argument(Config, [{packet, 5}, {line, 5}]),
  917:     ok.
  918: 
  919: %% Test that redirection of standard error to standard output works.
  920: stderr_to_stdout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  921:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  922:     %% See that it works
  923:     Packet = random_packet(10),
  924:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[Packet]}], 0, "-e -l10",
  925:                 [stderr_to_stdout]),
  926:     %% stream_ping(Config, 10, "-e", [stderr_to_stdout]),
  927:     %% See that it doesn't always happen (will generate garbage on stderr)
  928:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[eof]}], 0, "-e -l10", [line,eof]),
  929:     ok.
  930: 
  931: 
  932: bad_argument(Config, ArgList) ->
  933:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  934:     case catch open_port({spawn, PortTest}, ArgList) of
  935:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  936:             ok
  937:     end.
  938: 
  939: 
  940: %% 'env' option
  941: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
  942: %% in this module.)
  943: %%
  944: %% Test that the 'env' option works
  945: env(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
  946:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  947:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  948:     Temp = filename:join(Priv, "env_fun.bin"),
  949: 
  950:     PluppVal = "dirty monkey",
  951:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal}]),
  952: 
  953:     Long = "LongAndBoringEnvName",
  954:     os:putenv(Long, "nisse"),
  955: 
  956:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal},
  957:                      {"DIR_PLUPP","###glurfrik"}],
  958:               fun() ->
  959:                       PluppVal = os:getenv("plupp"),
  960:                       "###glurfrik" = os:getenv("DIR_PLUPP"),
  961:                       "nisse" = os:getenv(Long)
  962:               end),
  963: 
  964: 
  965:     env_slave(Temp, [{"must_define_something","some_value"},
  966:                      {"certainly_not_existing",false},
  967:                      {"ends_with_equal", "value="},
  968:                      {Long,false},
  969:                      {"glurf","a glorfy string"}]),
  970: 
  971:     %% A lot of non existing variables (mingled with existing)
  972:     NotExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_not_existing",[X])),false}
  973:                        ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  974:     ExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_existing",[X])),"a_value"}
  975:                     ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  976:     env_slave(Temp, lists:sort(ExistingList ++ NotExistingList)),
  977:     ok.
  978: 
  979: env_slave(File, Env) ->
  980:     F = fun() ->
  981:                 lists:foreach(fun({Name,Val}) ->
  982:                                       Val = os:getenv(Name)
  983:                               end, Env)
  984:         end,
  985:     env_slave(File, Env, F).
  986: 
  987: env_slave(File, Env, Body) ->
  988:     file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(Body)),
  989:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
  990:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  991:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Dir ++
  992:     " -noinput -run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " env_slave_main " ++
  993:     File ++ " -run erlang halt",
  994:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{env,Env},{line,256}]),
  995:     receive
  996:         {Port,{data,{eol,"ok"}}} ->
  997:             ok;
  998:         {Port,{data,{eol,Error}}} ->
  999:             ct:fail("eol error ~p\n", [Error]);
 1000:         Other ->
 1001:             ct:fail(Other)
 1002:     end.
 1003: 
 1004: env_slave_main([File]) ->
 1005:     {ok,Body0} = file:read_file(File),
 1006:     Body = binary_to_term(Body0),
 1007:     case Body() of
 1008:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
 1009:             io:format("Error: ~p\n", [Reason]);
 1010:         _ ->
 1011:             io:format("ok\n")
 1012:     end,
 1013:     init:stop().
 1014: 
 1015: 
 1016: %% 'env' option
 1017: %%   Test bad environments.
 1018: bad_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1019:     try_bad_env([abbb]),
 1020:     try_bad_env([{"key","value"}|{"another","value"}]),
 1021:     try_bad_env([{"key","value","value2"}]),
 1022:     try_bad_env([{"key",[a,b,c]}]),
 1023:     try_bad_env([{"key",value}]),
 1024:     try_bad_env({a,tuple}),
 1025:     try_bad_env(42),
 1026:     try_bad_env([a|b]),
 1027:     try_bad_env(self()),
 1028:     ok.
 1029: 
 1030: try_bad_env(Env) ->
 1031:     badarg = try open_port({spawn,"ls"}, [{env,Env}])
 1032: 	     catch
 1033: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1034: 	     end.
 1035: 
 1036: 
 1037: %% Test that we can handle a very very large environment gracefully.
 1038: huge_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1039:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 1040:     {Vars, Cmd} = case os:type() of
 1041:                       {win32,_} -> {500, "cmd /q /c ls"};
 1042:                       _ ->
 1043:                           %% We create a huge environment,
 1044:                           %% 20000 variables is about 25MB
 1045:                           %% which seems to be the limit on Linux.
 1046:                           {20000, "ls"}
 1047:                   end,
 1048:     Env = [{[$a + I div (25*25*25*25) rem 25,
 1049:              $a + I div (25*25*25) rem 25,
 1050:              $a + I div (25*25) rem 25,
 1051:              $a+I div 25 rem 25, $a+I rem 25],
 1052:             lists:duplicate(100,$a+I rem 25)}
 1053:            || I <- lists:seq(1,Vars)],
 1054:     try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1055:         P ->
 1056:             receive
 1057:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M when N > 127->
 1058:                     %% If exit status is > 127 something went very wrong
 1059:                     ct:fail("Open port failed got ~p",[M]);
 1060:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M ->
 1061:                     %% We test that the exit status is an integer, this means
 1062:                     %% that the child program has started. If we get an atom
 1063:                     %% something went wrong in the driver which is not ok.
 1064:                     ct:log("Got ~p",[M]),
 1065:                     true = is_integer(N)
 1066:             end
 1067:     catch E:R ->
 1068:               %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1069:               %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1070:               ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1071:     end.
 1072: 
 1073: %% Test to spawn program with command payload buffer
 1074: %% just around pipe capacity (9f779819f6bda734c5953468f7798)
 1075: pipe_limit_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1076:     WSL = os:getenv("WSLENV") =/= false,
 1077:     Cmd = case os:type() of
 1078:               {win32,_} when WSL -> "cmd.exe /q /c wsl true";
 1079:               {win32,_} -> "cmd /q /c true";
 1080:               _ -> "true"
 1081:           end,
 1082:     CmdSize = command_payload_size(Cmd),
 1083:     Limits = [4096, 16384, 65536], % Try a couple of common pipe buffer sizes
 1084: 
 1085:     lists:foreach(fun(Lim) ->
 1086: 			  lists:foreach(fun(L) -> pipe_limit_env_do(L, Cmd, CmdSize)
 1087: 					end, lists:seq(Lim-5, Lim+5))
 1088: 		  end, Limits),
 1089:     ok.
 1090: 
 1091: pipe_limit_env_do(Bytes, Cmd, CmdSize) ->
 1092:     case env_of_bytes(Bytes-CmdSize) of
 1093: 	[] -> skip;
 1094: 	Env ->
 1095: 	    try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1096: 		P ->
 1097: 		    receive
 1098: 			{P, {exit_status,N}} ->
 1099: 			    %% Bug caused exit_status 150 (EINVAL+128)
 1100: 			    0 = N
 1101: 		    end
 1102: 	    catch E:R ->
 1103: 		    %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1104: 		    %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1105: 		    ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1106: 	    end
 1107:     end.
 1108: 
 1109: %% environ format: KEY=VALUE\0
 1110: env_of_bytes(Bytes) when Bytes > 3 ->
 1111:     [{"X",lists:duplicate(Bytes-3, $x)}];
 1112: env_of_bytes(_) -> [].
 1113: 
 1114: %% White box assumption about payload written to pipe
 1115: %% for Cmd and current environment (see spawn_start in sys_driver.c)
 1116: command_payload_size(Cmd) ->
 1117:     EnvSize = lists:foldl(fun(E,Acc) -> length(E) + 1 + Acc end,
 1118: 			  0, os:getenv()),
 1119:     {ok, PWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1120:     (4                      % buffsz
 1121:      + 4                    % flags
 1122:      + 5 + length(Cmd) + 1  % "exec $Cmd"
 1123:      + length(PWD) + 1      % $PWD
 1124:      + 1                    % nullbuff
 1125:      + 4                    % env_len
 1126:      + EnvSize).
 1127: 
 1128: %%  Test bad 'args' options.
 1129: bad_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1130:     try_bad_args({args, [self()]}),
 1131:     try_bad_args({args, ["head" | "tail"]}),
 1132:     try_bad_args({args, ["head", "body" | "tail"]}),
 1133:     try_bad_args({args, [<<"head">>, <<"body">> | <<"tail">>]}),
 1134:     try_bad_args({args, not_a_list}),
 1135:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>, 1472, "string"]}),
 1136:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>], "element #3"}),
 1137:     ok.
 1138: 
 1139: try_bad_args(Args) ->
 1140:     badarg = try open_port({spawn_executable,"ls"}, [Args])
 1141: 	     catch
 1142: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1143: 	     end.
 1144: 
 1145: 
 1146: 
 1147: %% 'cd' option
 1148: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
 1149: %% in this module.)
 1150: %%
 1151: %% Test that the 'cd' option works
 1152: cd(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1153:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1154: 
 1155:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1156:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1157:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1158:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ DataDir ++
 1159:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1160:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1161:                   [{cd, TestDir}, {line, 256}]),
 1162:     receive
 1163:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1164:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1165:                 true ->
 1166:                     ok;
 1167:                 false ->
 1168:                     ct:fail({cd, String})
 1169:             end;
 1170:         Other2 ->
 1171:             ct:fail({env, Other2})
 1172:     end,
 1173:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1174:                   [{cd, unicode:characters_to_binary(TestDir)},
 1175:                    {line, 256}]),
 1176:     receive
 1177:         {_, {data, {eol, String2}}} ->
 1178:             case filename_equal(String2, TestDir) of
 1179:                 true ->
 1180:                     ok;
 1181:                 false ->
 1182:                     ct:fail({cd, String2})
 1183:             end;
 1184:         Other3 ->
 1185:             ct:fail({env, Other3})
 1186:     end,
 1187: 
 1188:     InvalidDir = filename:join(DataDir, "invaliddir"),
 1189:     try open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1190:                   [{cd, InvalidDir}, exit_status, {line, 256}]) of
 1191:         _ ->
 1192:             receive
 1193:                 {_, {exit_status, _}} ->
 1194:                     ok;
 1195:                 Other4 ->
 1196:                     ct:fail({env, Other4})
 1197:             end
 1198:     catch error:eacces ->
 1199:             %% This happens on Windows
 1200:             ok
 1201:     end,
 1202: 
 1203:     %% Check that there are no lingering messages
 1204:     receive
 1205:         Other5 ->
 1206:             ct:fail({env, Other5})
 1207:     after 10 ->
 1208:             ok
 1209:     end.
 1210: 
 1211: %% Test that an emulator that has set it's cwd to
 1212: %% something other then when it started, can use
 1213: %% relative {cd,"./"} to open port and that cd will
 1214: %% be relative the new cwd and not the original
 1215: cd_relative(Config) ->
 1216: 
 1217:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1218:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1219:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1220: 
 1221:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ filename:dirname(code:where_is_file("port_SUITE.beam")) ++
 1222:     " -noshell -s port_SUITE relative_cd -s erlang halt",
 1223: 
 1224:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, TestDir}]),
 1225: 
 1226:     receive
 1227:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1228:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1229:                 true ->
 1230:                     ok;
 1231:                 false ->
 1232:                     ct:fail({cd_relative, String})
 1233:             end;
 1234:         Other ->
 1235:             ct:fail(Other)
 1236:     end.
 1237: 
 1238: relative_cd() ->
 1239: 
 1240:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1241:     ok = file:set_cwd(".."),
 1242:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1243: 
 1244:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Cwd ++
 1245:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1246: 
 1247:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, "./dir"}, exit_status]),
 1248: 
 1249:     receive
 1250:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1251:             io:format("~s~n",[String]);
 1252:         Other ->
 1253:             io:format("ERROR: ~p~n",[Other])
 1254:     end.
 1255: 
 1256: filename_equal(A, B) ->
 1257:     case os:type() of
 1258:         {win32, _} ->
 1259:             win_filename_equal(A, B);
 1260:         _ ->
 1261:             A == B
 1262:     end.
 1263: 
 1264: win_filename_equal([], []) ->
 1265:     true;
 1266: win_filename_equal([], _) ->
 1267:     false;
 1268: win_filename_equal(_, []) ->
 1269:     false;
 1270: win_filename_equal([C1 | Rest1], [C2 | Rest2]) ->
 1271:     case tolower(C1) == tolower(C2) of
 1272:         true ->
 1273:             win_filename_equal(Rest1, Rest2);
 1274:         false ->
 1275:             false
 1276:     end.
 1277: 
 1278: tolower(C) when C >= $A, C =< $Z ->
 1279:     C + 32;
 1280: tolower(C) ->
 1281:     C.
 1282: 
 1283: %% Tests that child process deaths are managed correctly when there are
 1284: %%  a large amount of concurrently dying children. See ticket OTP-3906.
 1285: otp_3906(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1286:     case os:type() of
 1287:         {unix, OSName} ->
 1288:             otp_3906(Config, OSName);
 1289:         _ ->
 1290:             {skipped, "Only run on Unix systems"}
 1291:     end.
 1292: 
 1293: -define(OTP_3906_CHILDREN,     1000).
 1294: -define(OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS,  17).
 1295: -define(OTP_3906_PROGNAME,     "otp_3906").
 1296: -define(OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT, 5000).
 1297: -define(OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,   10).
 1298: -define(OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP, 50).
 1299: 
 1300: otp_3906(Config, OSName) ->
 1301:     DataDir = filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)),
 1302:     {ok, Variables, _} = file:path_consult(code:get_path(),"variables"),
 1303:     case lists:keysearch('CC', 1, Variables) of
 1304:         {value,{'CC', CC}} ->
 1305:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1306:             Prog = otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir),
 1307:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1308:             OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1309:             OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1310:             FS = spawn_link(Node,
 1311:                             ?MODULE,
 1312:                             otp_3906_start_forker_starter,
 1313:                             [?OTP_3906_CHILDREN, [], self(), Prog]),
 1314:             Result = receive
 1315:                          {'EXIT', _ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1316:                              {failed, Reason};
 1317:                          {emulator_pid, EmPid} ->
 1318:                              case otp_3906_wait_result(FS, 0, 0) of
 1319:                                  {succeeded,
 1320:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN,
 1321:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN} ->
 1322:                                      succeeded;
 1323:                                  {succeeded, Forked, Exited} ->
 1324:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1325:                                      {failed,
 1326:                                       {mismatch,
 1327:                                        {forked, Forked},
 1328:                                        {exited, Exited}}};
 1329:                                  Res ->
 1330:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1331:                                      Res
 1332:                              end
 1333:                      end,
 1334:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1335:             process_flag(priority, OP),
 1336:             peer:stop(Peer),
 1337:             case Result of
 1338:                 succeeded ->
 1339:                     ok;
 1340:                 _ ->
 1341:                     ct:fail(Result)
 1342:             end;
 1343:         _ ->
 1344:             {skipped, "No C compiler found"}
 1345:     end.
 1346: 
 1347: otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName) ->
 1348:     % Guess ps switches to use and what to grep for (could be improved)
 1349:     {Switches, Zombie} = case OSName of
 1350:                              BSD when BSD == darwin;
 1351:                                       BSD == openbsd;
 1352:                                       BSD == netbsd;
 1353:                                       BSD == freebsd ->
 1354:                                  {"-ajx", "Z"};
 1355:                              _ ->
 1356:                                  {"-ef", "[dD]efunct"}
 1357:                          end,
 1358:     io:format("Emulator pid: ~s~n"
 1359:               "Listing of zombie processes:~n"
 1360:               "~s~n",
 1361:               [EmPid,
 1362:                otp_3906_htmlize(os:cmd("ps "
 1363:                                        ++ Switches
 1364:                                        ++ " | grep "
 1365:                                        ++ Zombie))]).
 1366: 
 1367: otp_3906_htmlize([]) ->
 1368:     [];
 1369: otp_3906_htmlize([C | Cs]) ->
 1370:     case [C] of
 1371:         "<" -> "&lt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1372:         ">" -> "&gt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1373:         _ ->   [C | otp_3906_htmlize(Cs)]
 1374:     end.
 1375: 
 1376: otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir) ->
 1377:     SrcFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME ++ ".c"),
 1378:     TrgtFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME),
 1379:     {ok, SrcFile} = file:open(SrcFileName, write),
 1380:     io:format(SrcFile,
 1381:               "int           ~n"
 1382:               "main(void)    ~n"
 1383:               "{             ~n"
 1384:               "   return ~p; ~n"
 1385:               "}             ~n",
 1386:               [?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS]),
 1387:     file:close(SrcFile),
 1388:     os:cmd(CC ++ " " ++ SrcFileName ++ " -o " ++ TrgtFileName),
 1389:     TrgtFileName.
 1390: 
 1391: 
 1392: otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E) ->
 1393:     receive
 1394:         {'EXIT', ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1395:             {failed, {Reason, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}};
 1396:         forked ->
 1397:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F+1, E);
 1398:         exited ->
 1399:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E+1);
 1400:         tick ->
 1401:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E);
 1402:         succeeded ->
 1403:             {succeeded, F, E}
 1404:     after
 1405:         ?OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT ->
 1406:             unlink(ForkerStarter),
 1407:             exit(ForkerStarter, timeout),
 1408:             {failed, {timeout, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}}
 1409:     end.
 1410: 
 1411: otp_3906_collect([], _) ->
 1412:     done;
 1413: otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup) ->
 1414:     otp_3906_collect(otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup).
 1415: 
 1416: otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup) ->
 1417:     receive
 1418:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 1419:             Sup ! tick,
 1420:             lists:delete(Ref, RefList)
 1421:     end.
 1422: 
 1423: otp_3906_start_forker(N, Sup, Prog) ->
 1424:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1425:     spawn_opt(?MODULE,
 1426:               otp_3906_forker,
 1427:               [N, self(), Ref, Sup, Prog],
 1428:               [link, {priority, max}]),
 1429:     Ref.
 1430: 
 1431: otp_3906_start_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) ->
 1432:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1433:     EmPid = os:getpid(),
 1434:     Sup ! {emulator_pid, EmPid},
 1435:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog).
 1436: 
 1437: otp_3906_forker_starter(0, RefList, Sup, _) ->
 1438:     otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup),
 1439:     unlink(Sup),
 1440:     Sup ! succeeded;
 1441: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1442:   when length(RefList) >= ?OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP ->
 1443:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup, Prog);
 1444: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1445:   when is_integer(N), N > ?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP ->
 1446:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N-?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1447:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1448:                                                    Sup,
 1449:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1450:                             Sup,
 1451:                             Prog);
 1452: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) when is_integer(N) ->
 1453:     otp_3906_forker_starter(0,
 1454:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(N,
 1455:                                                    Sup,
 1456:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1457:                             Sup,
 1458:                             Prog).
 1459: 
 1460: otp_3906_forker(0, Parent, Ref, _, _) ->
 1461:     unlink(Parent),
 1462:     Parent ! Ref;
 1463: otp_3906_forker(N, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog) ->
 1464:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, Prog}, [exit_status, in]),
 1465:     Sup ! forked,
 1466:     receive
 1467:         {Port, {exit_status, ?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS}} ->
 1468:             Sup ! exited,
 1469:             otp_3906_forker(N-1, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog);
 1470:         {Port, Res} ->
 1471:             exit(Res);
 1472:         Other ->
 1473:             exit(Other)
 1474:     end.
 1475: 
 1476: 
 1477: otp_4389(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1478:     case os:type() of
 1479:         {unix, _} ->
 1480:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
 1481:             TCR = self(),
 1482:             %% On MacOS Catalina libc can return enoent instead of emfile for cwd
 1483:             BrokenCWD = (os:type() =:= {unix,darwin}) andalso element(1,os:version()) == 19,
 1484:             case get_true_cmd() of
 1485:                 True when is_list(True) ->
 1486:                     lists:foreach(
 1487:                       fun (P) ->
 1488:                               receive
 1489:                                   {P, ok} ->  ok;
 1490:                                   {P, Err} -> ct:fail(Err)
 1491:                               end
 1492:                       end,
 1493:                       lists:map(
 1494:                         fun(_) ->
 1495:                                 spawn_link(
 1496:                                   fun() ->
 1497:                                           process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1498:                                           case catch open_port({spawn, True},
 1499:                                                                [stream,exit_status]) of
 1500:                                               P when is_port(P) ->
 1501:                                                   receive
 1502:                                                       {P,{exit_status,_}} ->
 1503:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1504:                                                       {'EXIT',_,{R2,_}}
 1505:                                                         when R2 == emfile;
 1506:                                                              R2 == eagain;
 1507:                                                              R2 == enomem;
 1508:                                                              R2 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1509:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1510:                                                       Err2 ->
 1511:                                                           TCR ! {self(),{msg,Err2}}
 1512:                                                   end;
 1513:                                               {'EXIT',{R1,_}}
 1514:                                                 when R1 == emfile;
 1515:                                                      R1 == eagain;
 1516:                                                      R1 == enomem;
 1517:                                                      R1 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1518:                                                   TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1519:                                               Err1 ->
 1520:                                                   TCR ! {self(), {open_port,Err1}}
 1521:                                           end
 1522:                                   end)
 1523:                         end,
 1524:                         lists:duplicate(1000,[]))),
 1525:                     {comment,
 1526:                      "This test case doesn't always fail when the bug that "
 1527:                      "it tests for is present (it is most likely to fail on"
 1528:                      " a multi processor machine). If the test case fails it"
 1529:                      " will fail by deadlocking the emulator."};
 1530:                 _ ->
 1531:                     {skipped, "\"true\" command not found"}
 1532:             end;
 1533:         _ ->
 1534:             {skip,"Only run on Unix"}
 1535:     end.
 1536: 
 1537: get_true_cmd() ->
 1538:     DoFileExist = fun (FileName) ->
 1539:                           case file:read_file_info(FileName) of
 1540:                               {ok, _} -> throw(FileName);
 1541:                               _ -> not_found
 1542:                           end
 1543:                   end,
 1544:     catch begin
 1545:               %% First check in /usr/bin and /bin
 1546:               DoFileExist("/usr/bin/true"),
 1547:               DoFileExist("/bin/true"),
 1548:               %% Try which
 1549:               case filename:dirname(os:cmd("which true")) of
 1550:                   "." -> not_found;
 1551:                   TrueDir -> filename:join(TrueDir, "true")
 1552:               end
 1553:           end.
 1554: 
 1555: %% 'exit_status' option
 1556: %%
 1557: %% Test that the 'exit_status' option works
 1558: exit_status(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1559:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1560:     port_expect(Config,
 1561:                 [{"x", [{exit_status, 5}]}],
 1562:                 1, "", [exit_status]),
 1563:     ok.
 1564: 
 1565: %% Test spawning a driver specifically
 1566: spawn_driver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1567:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1568:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1569:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1570:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1571:     receive
 1572:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1573:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1574:             ok;
 1575:         Other ->
 1576:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1577:     end,
 1578:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1579:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1580: 
 1581:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1582:                              []),
 1583:     receive
 1584:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1585:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1586:             ok;
 1587:         Other2 ->
 1588:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1589:     end,
 1590:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1591:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1592:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "ls"}, [])),
 1593:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "cmd"}, [])),
 1594:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, os:find_executable("erl")}, [])),
 1595:     ok.
 1596: 
 1597: %% Test parallelism option of open_port
 1598: parallelism_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1599:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1600:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1601:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
 1602:                             [{parallelism, true}]),
 1603:     {parallelism, true} = erlang:port_info(Port, parallelism),
 1604:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1605:     receive
 1606:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1607:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1608:             ok;
 1609:         Other ->
 1610:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1611:     end,
 1612:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1613:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1614: 
 1615:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1616:                              [{parallelism, false}]),
 1617:     {parallelism, false} = erlang:port_info(Port2, parallelism),
 1618:     receive
 1619:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1620:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1621:             ok;
 1622:         Other2 ->
 1623:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1624:     end,
 1625:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1626:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1627:     ok.
 1628: 
 1629: %% Test spawning an executable specifically
 1630: spawn_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1631:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1632:     EchoArgs1 = filename:join([DataDir,"echo_args"]),
 1633:     ExactFile1 = filename:nativename(os:find_executable(EchoArgs1)),
 1634:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[]),
 1635:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary]),
 1636:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_args"]),
 1637:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_args"]),
 1638:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1639:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_arguments"]),
 1640:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1641:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1642:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[default]),
 1643:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, default]),
 1644:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1645:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1646:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1647:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1648:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary,switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1649:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1650:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1651:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1652: 
 1653:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1654:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1655:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1656:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1657: 
 1658:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1659:     SpaceDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"With Spaces"]),
 1660:     file:make_dir(SpaceDir),
 1661:     Executable = filename:basename(ExactFile1),
 1662:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1663:     ExactFile2 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1664:     chmodplusx(ExactFile2),
 1665:     io:format("|~s|~n",[ExactFile2]),
 1666:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[]),
 1667:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_args"]),
 1668:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1669:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1670:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1671:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1672:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1673: 
 1674:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1675:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1676:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1677:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1678: 
 1679:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default]),
 1680:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1681:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[switch_order,ExactFile2,"hello world", "dlrow olleh"]),
 1682:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1683:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1684:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1685:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1686:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1687:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1688: 
 1689:     ExeExt = filename:extension(ExactFile2),
 1690:     Executable2 = "spoky name"++ExeExt,
 1691:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1692:     ExactFile3 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1693:     chmodplusx(ExactFile3),
 1694:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[]),
 1695:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_args"]),
 1696:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_arguments"]),
 1697:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1698:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1699:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[default]),
 1700:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1701:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1702:                   [switch_order,ExactFile3,"hello world",
 1703:                    "dlrow olleh"]),
 1704:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1705:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1706:                   [default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1707:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1708:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1709:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1710:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1711:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,"fnurflmonfi",
 1712:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1713:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1714: 
 1715:     NonExec = "kronxfrt"++ExeExt,
 1716:     file:write_file(filename:join([SpaceDir,NonExec]),
 1717:                     <<"Not an executable">>),
 1718:     {'EXIT',{eacces,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,NonExec,
 1719:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1720:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1721:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"cmd"},[])),
 1722:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"sh"},[])),
 1723:     case os:type() of
 1724:         {win32,_} ->
 1725:             test_bat_file(SpaceDir);
 1726:         {unix,_} ->
 1727:             test_sh_file(SpaceDir)
 1728:     end,
 1729:     ok.
 1730: 
 1731: unregister_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1732:     Cmd = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
 1733:               false -> "sleep 5";
 1734:               _ -> "wsl.exe sleep 5"
 1735:           end,
 1736:     true = register(crash, open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [])),
 1737:     true = unregister(crash).
 1738: 
 1739: test_bat_file(Dir) ->
 1740:     FN = "tf.bat",
 1741:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1742:     D = [<<"@echo off\r\n">>,
 1743:          <<"echo argv[0]:^|%0^|\r\n">>,
 1744:          <<"if \"%1\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1745:          <<"echo argv[1]:^|%1^|\r\n">>,
 1746:          <<"if \"%2\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1747:          <<"echo argv[2]:^|%2^|\r\n">>,
 1748:          <<"if \"%3\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1749:          <<"echo argv[3]:^|%3^|\r\n">>,
 1750:          <<"if \"%4\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1751:          <<"echo argv[4]:^|%4^|\r\n">>,
 1752:          <<"if \"%5\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1753:          <<"echo argv[5]:^|%5^|\r\n">>,
 1754:          <<"\r\n">>,
 1755:          <<":done\r\n">>,
 1756:          <<"\r\n">>],
 1757:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1758:     EF = filename:basename(FN),
 1759:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1760:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1761:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1762:     %% The arg0 argument should be ignored when running batch files
 1763:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1764:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1765:                   ["knaskurt","hello","world"]),
 1766:     EF = filename:basename(DN),
 1767:     ok.
 1768: 
 1769: test_sh_file(Dir) ->
 1770:     FN = "tf.sh",
 1771:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1772:     D = [<<"#! /bin/sh\n">>,
 1773:          <<"echo 'argv[0]:|'$0'|'\n">>,
 1774:          <<"i=1\n">>,
 1775:          <<"while [ '!' -z \"$1\" ]; do\n">>,
 1776:          <<"    echo 'argv['$i']:|'\"$1\"'|'\n">>,
 1777:          <<"    shift\n">>,
 1778:          <<"    i=`expr $i + 1`\n">>,
 1779:          <<"done\n">>],
 1780:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1781:     chmodplusx(Full),
 1782:     [Full,"hello","world"] =
 1783:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1784:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1785:     [Full,"hello","world of spaces"] =
 1786:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1787:                   [default,"hello","world of spaces"]),
 1788:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile1"]),<<"testdata1">>),
 1789:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile2"]),<<"testdata2">>),
 1790:     Pattern = filename:join([Dir,"testfile*"]),
 1791:     L = filelib:wildcard(Pattern),
 1792:     2 = length(L),
 1793:     [Full,"hello",Pattern] =
 1794:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1795:                   [default,"hello",Pattern]),
 1796:     ok.
 1797: 
 1798: 
 1799: 
 1800: chmodplusx(Filename) ->
 1801:     case file:read_file_info(Filename) of
 1802:         {ok,FI} ->
 1803:             FI2 = FI#file_info{mode = ((FI#file_info.mode) bor 8#00100)},
 1804:             file:write_file_info(Filename,FI2);
 1805:         _ ->
 1806:             ok
 1807:     end.
 1808: 
 1809: run_echo_args_2(FullnameAndArgs) ->
 1810:     Port = open_port({spawn,FullnameAndArgs},[eof]),
 1811:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1812:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1813:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1814:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1815: 
 1816: 
 1817: run_echo_args(Where,Args) ->
 1818:     run_echo_args(Where,"echo_args",Args).
 1819: run_echo_args(Where,Prog,Args) ->
 1820:     {Binary, ArgvArg} = pack_argv(Args),
 1821:     Command0 = filename:join([Where,Prog]),
 1822:     Command = case Binary of
 1823:                   true -> unicode:characters_to_binary(Command0);
 1824:                   false -> Command0
 1825:               end,
 1826:     Port = open_port({spawn_executable,Command},ArgvArg++[eof]),
 1827:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1828:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1829:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1830:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1831: 
 1832: pack_argv([binary|Args]) ->
 1833:     {true, pack_argv(Args, true)};
 1834: pack_argv(Args) ->
 1835:     {false, pack_argv(Args, false)}.
 1836: 
 1837: pack_argv(Args, Binary) ->
 1838:     case Args of
 1839:         [] ->
 1840:             [];
 1841:         [default|T] ->
 1842:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}];
 1843:         [switch_order,H|T] ->
 1844:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]},{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)}];
 1845:         [H|T] ->
 1846:             [{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)},{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}]
 1847:     end.
 1848: 
 1849: make_bin(Str, false) -> Str;
 1850: make_bin(Str, true) ->  unicode:characters_to_binary(Str).
 1851: 
 1852: collect_data(Port) ->
 1853:     receive
 1854:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 1855:             Data ++ collect_data(Port);
 1856:         {Port, eof} ->
 1857:             []
 1858:     end.
 1859: 
 1860: parse_echo_args_output(Data) ->
 1861:     [lists:last(string:lexemes(S,"|")) || S <- string:lexemes(Data,["\r\n",$\n])].
 1862: 
 1863: %% Test that the emulator does not mix up ports when the port table wraps
 1864: mix_up_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1865:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1866:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1867:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1868:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1869:     receive
 1870:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1871:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1872:             ok;
 1873:         Other ->
 1874:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1875:     end,
 1876:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1877:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1878:     loop(start, done,
 1879:          fun(P) ->
 1880:                  Q =
 1881:                  (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, [])),
 1882:                  %%		       io:format("~p ", [Q]),
 1883:                  if is_port(Q) ->
 1884:                         Q;
 1885:                     true ->
 1886:                         io:format("~p~n", [P]),
 1887:                         done
 1888:                  end
 1889:          end),
 1890:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello again port!"}},
 1891:     receive
 1892:         Msg2 ->
 1893:             ct:fail({unexpected, Msg2})
 1894:     after 1000 ->
 1895:               ok
 1896:     end,
 1897:     ok.
 1898: 
 1899: loop(Stop, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1900:     ok;
 1901: loop(Start, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1902:     loop(Fun(Start), Stop, Fun).
 1903: 
 1904: 
 1905: %% Test that link to connected process is taken away when port calls
 1906: %% driver_exit() also when the port index has wrapped
 1907: otp_5112(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1908:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1909:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1910:     Port = otp_5112_get_wrapped_port(),
 1911:     io:format("Max ports: ~p~n",[max_ports()]),
 1912:     io:format("Port: ~p~n",[Port]),
 1913:     {links, Links1} = process_info(self(),links),
 1914:     io:format("Links1: ~p~n",[Links1]),
 1915:     true = lists:member(Port, Links1),
 1916:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1917:     wait_until(fun () -> lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()) == false end),
 1918:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Give signal some time to propagate...
 1919:     {links, Links2} = process_info(self(),links),
 1920:     io:format("Links2: ~p~n",[Links2]),
 1921:     false = lists:member(Port, Links2), %% This used to fail
 1922:     ok.
 1923: 
 1924: otp_5112_get_wrapped_port() ->
 1925:     P1 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1926:     case port_ix(P1) < max_ports() of
 1927:         true ->
 1928:             io:format("Need to wrap port index (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1929:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([P1]),
 1930:             P2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1931:             false = port_ix(P2) < max_ports(),
 1932:             P2;
 1933:         false ->
 1934:             io:format("Port index already wrapped (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1935:             P1
 1936:     end.
 1937: 
 1938: otp_5112_wrap_port_ix(Ports) ->
 1939:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1940:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1941:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([Port|Ports]);
 1942:         _ ->
 1943:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1944:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1945:                           Ports),
 1946:             ok
 1947:     end.
 1948: 
 1949: 
 1950: %% Test that port index is not unnecessarily wrapped
 1951: otp_5119(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1952:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1953:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1954:     PI1 = port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([])),
 1955:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1956:     PI2 = port_ix(Port2),
 1957:     {PortIx1, PortIx2} = case PI2 > PI1 of
 1958:                              true ->
 1959:                                  {PI1, PI2};
 1960:                              false ->
 1961:                                  {port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port2])),
 1962:                                   port_ix(erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []))}
 1963:                          end,
 1964:     MaxPorts = max_ports(),
 1965:     io:format("PortIx1 = ~p ~p~n", [PI1, PortIx1]),
 1966:     io:format("PortIx2 = ~p ~p~n", [PI2, PortIx2]),
 1967:     io:format("MaxPorts = ~p~n", [MaxPorts]),
 1968:     true = PortIx2 > PortIx1,
 1969:     true = PortIx2 =< PortIx1 + MaxPorts,
 1970:     ok.
 1971: 
 1972: otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab(Ports) ->
 1973:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1974:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1975:             otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port|Ports]);
 1976:         _ ->
 1977:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1978:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1979:                           Ports),
 1980:             [LastPort|_] = Ports,
 1981:             LastPort
 1982:     end.
 1983: 
 1984: max_ports() ->
 1985:     erlang:system_info(port_limit).
 1986: 
 1987: port_ix(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1988:     ["#Port",_,PortIxStr] = string:lexemes(erlang:port_to_list(Port),
 1989:                                           "<.>"),
