 1990:     list_to_integer(PortIxStr).
 1991: 
 1992: 
 1993: %% Check that port command failure doesn't crash the emulator
 1994: otp_6224(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1995:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1996:     ok = load_driver(Path, "failure_drv"),
 1997:     Go = make_ref(),
 1998:     Failer = spawn(fun () ->
 1999:                            receive Go -> ok end,
 2000:                            Port = open_port({spawn, "failure_drv"},
 2001:                                             []),
 2002:                            Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2003:                            otp_6224_loop()
 2004:                    end),
 2005:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Failer),
 2006:     Failer ! Go,
 2007:     receive
 2008:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Failer, Reason} ->
 2009:             case Reason of
 2010:                 {driver_failed, _} -> ok;
 2011:                 driver_failed -> ok;
 2012:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason,
 2013:                               Reason})
 2014:             end
 2015:     end,
 2016:     ok.
 2017: 
 2018: otp_6224_loop() ->
 2019:     receive _ -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2020:     otp_6224_loop().
 2021: 
 2022: 
 2023: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS, 64).
 2024: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS, 300).
 2025: 
 2026: exit_status_multi_scheduling_block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2027:     Repeat = 3,
 2028:     case os:type() of
 2029:         {unix, _} ->
 2030:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 2*Repeat}),
 2031:             SleepSecs = 6,
 2032:             try
 2033:                 lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2034:                                       exit_status_msb_test(Config,
 2035:                                                            SleepSecs)
 2036:                               end,
 2037:                               lists:seq(1, Repeat))
 2038:             after
 2039:                 %% Wait for the system to recover (regardless
 2040:                 %% of success or not) otherwise later testcases
 2041:                 %% may unnecessarily fail.
 2042:                 receive after SleepSecs+500 -> ok end
 2043:             end;
 2044:         _ -> {skip, "Not implemented for this OS"}
 2045:     end.
 2046: 
 2047: exit_status_msb_test(Config, SleepSecs) when is_list(Config) ->
 2048:     %%
 2049:     %% We want to start port programs from as many schedulers as possible
 2050:     %% and we want these port programs to terminate while multi-scheduling
 2051:     %% is blocked.
 2052:     %%
 2053:     NoSchedsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2054:     Parent = self(),
 2055:     io:format("SleepSecs = ~p~n", [SleepSecs]),
 2056:     PortProg = "sleep " ++ integer_to_list(SleepSecs),
 2057:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond),
 2058:     NoProcs = case NoSchedsOnln of
 2059:                   NProcs when NProcs < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS ->
 2060:                       NProcs;
 2061:                   _ ->
 2062:                       ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS
 2063:               end,
 2064:     NoPortsPerProc = case 20*NoProcs of
 2065:                          TNPorts when TNPorts < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS -> 20;
 2066:                          _ -> ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS div NoProcs
 2067:                      end,
 2068:     io:format("NoProcs = ~p~nNoPortsPerProc = ~p~n",
 2069:               [NoProcs, NoPortsPerProc]),
 2070:     ProcFun
 2071:     = fun () ->
 2072:               PrtSIds = lists:map(
 2073:                           fun (_) ->
 2074:                                   erlang:yield(),
 2075:                                   case catch open_port({spawn, PortProg},
 2076:                                                        [exit_status]) of
 2077:                                       Prt when is_port(Prt) ->
 2078:                                           {Prt,
 2079:                                            erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)};
 2080:                                       {'EXIT', {Err, _}} when Err == eagain;
 2081:                                                               Err == emfile;
 2082:                                                               Err == enomem ->
 2083:                                           noop;
 2084:                                       {'EXIT', Err} when Err == eagain;
 2085:                                                          Err == emfile;
 2086:                                                          Err == enomem ->
 2087:                                           noop;
 2088:                                       Error ->
 2089:                                           ct:fail(Error)
 2090:                                   end
 2091:                           end,
 2092:                           lists:seq(1, NoPortsPerProc)),
 2093:               SIds = lists:filter(fun (noop) -> false;
 2094:                                       (_) -> true
 2095:                                   end,
 2096:                                   lists:map(fun (noop) -> noop;
 2097:                                                 ({_, SId}) -> SId
 2098:                                             end,
 2099:                                             PrtSIds)),
 2100:               process_flag(scheduler, 0),
 2101:               Parent ! {self(), started, SIds},
 2102:               lists:foreach(
 2103:                 fun (noop) ->
 2104:                         noop;
 2105:                     ({Port, _}) ->
 2106:                         receive
 2107:                             {Port, {exit_status, 0}} ->
 2108:                                 ok;
 2109:                             {Port, {exit_status, Status}} when Status > 128 ->
 2110:                                 %% Sometimes happens when we have created
 2111:                                 %% too many ports.
 2112:                                 ok;
 2113:                             {Port, {exit_status, _}} = ESMsg ->
 2114:                                 {Port, {exit_status, 0}} = ESMsg
 2115:                         end
 2116:                 end,
 2117:                 PrtSIds),
 2118:               Parent ! {self(), done}
 2119:       end,
 2120:     Procs = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 2121:                               spawn_opt(ProcFun,
 2122:                                         [link,
 2123:                                          {scheduler,
 2124:                                           (N rem NoSchedsOnln)+1}])
 2125:                       end,
 2126:                       lists:seq(1, NoProcs)),
 2127:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2128:                              receive {P, started, SIds} -> SIds end
 2129:                      end,
 2130:                      Procs),
 2131:     StartedTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2132:     io:format("StartedTime = ~p~n", [StartedTime]),
 2133:     true = StartedTime < SleepSecs,
 2134:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2135:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end, Procs),
 2136:     DoneTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2137:     io:format("DoneTime = ~p~n", [DoneTime]),
 2138:     true = DoneTime > SleepSecs,
 2139:     ok = verify_multi_scheduling_blocked(),
 2140:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2141:     case {length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))), NoSchedsOnln} of
 2142:         {N, N} ->
 2143:             ok;
 2144:         {N, M} ->
 2145:             ct:fail("Failed to create ports on all ~w available"
 2146:                     "schedulers. Only created ports on ~w schedulers.", [M, N])
 2147:     end.
 2148: 
 2149: save_sid(SIds) ->
 2150:     SId = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2151:     case lists:member(SId, SIds) of
 2152:         true -> SIds;
 2153:         false -> [SId|SIds]
 2154:     end.
 2155: 
 2156: sid_proc(SIds) ->
 2157:     NewSIds = save_sid(SIds),
 2158:     receive
 2159:         {From, want_sids} ->
 2160:             From ! {self(), sids, NewSIds}
 2161:     after 0 ->
 2162:               sid_proc(NewSIds)
 2163:     end.
 2164: 
 2165: verify_multi_scheduling_blocked() ->
 2166:     Procs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2167:                               spawn_link(fun () -> sid_proc([]) end)
 2168:                       end,
 2169:                       lists:seq(1, 3*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 2170:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2171:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2172:                              P ! {self(), want_sids},
 2173:                              receive {P, sids, PSIds} -> PSIds end
 2174:                      end,
 2175:                      Procs),
 2176:     1 = length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))),
 2177:     ok.
 2178: 
 2179: 
 2180: %%% Pinging functions.
 2181: 
 2182: stream_ping(Config, Size, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2183:     Data = random_packet(Size),
 2184:     port_expect(Config, [{Data, [Data]}], 0, CmdLine, Options).
 2185: 
 2186: ping(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2187:     Actions = lists:map(fun(Size) ->
 2188:                                 [$p|Packet] = random_packet(Size, "ping"),
 2189:                                 {[$p|Packet], [[$P|Packet]]}
 2190:                         end,
 2191:                         Sizes),
 2192:     port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2193: 
 2194: %% expect_input(Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2195: %%
 2196: %% Sizes = Size of packets to generated.
 2197: %% HSize = Header size: 1, 2, or 4
 2198: %% CmdLine = Additional command line options.
 2199: %% Options = Additional port options.
 2200: 
 2201: expect_input(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2202:     expect_input1(Config, Sizes, {HSize, CmdLine, Options}, [], []).
 2203: 
 2204: expect_input1(Config, [0|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2205:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [""|Expect], ["x0"|ReplyCommand]);
 2206: expect_input1(Config, [Size|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2207:     Packet = random_packet(Size),
 2208:     Fmt = io_lib:format("~c~p", [hd(Packet), Size]),
 2209:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [Packet|Expect], [Fmt|ReplyCommand]);
 2210: expect_input1(Config, [], {HSize, CmdLine0, Options}, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2211:     CmdLine = build_cmd_line(CmdLine0, ReplyCommand, []),
 2212:     port_expect(Config, [{false, lists:reverse(Expect)}],
 2213:                 HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2214: 
 2215: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], []) ->
 2216:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd]);
 2217: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], Result) ->
 2218:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd, $:|Result]);
 2219: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [], Result) ->
 2220:     lists:flatten([FixedCmdLine, " -r", Result, " -n"]).
 2221: 
 2222: %% port_expect(Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2223: %%
 2224: %% Actions = [{Send, ExpectList}|Rest]
 2225: %% HSize = 0 (stream), or 1, 2, 4   (header size aka "packet bytes")
 2226: %% CmdLine = Command line for port_test.  Don't include -h<digit>.
 2227: %% Options = Options for open_port/2.  Don't include {packet, Number} or
 2228: %%           or stream.
 2229: %%
 2230: %% Send = false | list()
 2231: %% ExpectList = List of lists or binaries.
 2232: %%
 2233: %% Returns the port.
 2234: 
 2235: port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0) ->
 2236:     %    io:format("port_expect(~p, ~p, ~p, ~p)",
 2237:     %		[Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0]),
 2238:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
 2239:     Cmd = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h", HSize, " ", CmdLine]),
 2240:     PortType =
 2241:     case HSize of
 2242:         0 -> stream;
 2243:         _ -> {packet, HSize}
 2244:     end,
 2245:     Options = [PortType|Options0],
 2246:     ct:log("open_port({spawn, ~p}, ~p)", [Cmd, Options]),
 2247:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, Options),
 2248:     port_expect(Port, Actions, Options),
 2249:     Port.
 2250: 
 2251: port_expect(Port, [{Send, Expects}|Rest], Options) when is_list(Expects) ->
 2252:     port_send(Port, Send),
 2253:     IsBinaryPort = lists:member(binary, Options),
 2254:     Receiver =
 2255:     case {lists:member(stream, Options), line_option(Options)} of
 2256:         {false, _} -> fun receive_all/2;
 2257:         {true,false}  -> fun stream_receive_all/2;
 2258:         {_, true} -> fun receive_all/2
 2259:     end,
 2260:     Receiver(Port, maybe_to_binary(Expects, IsBinaryPort)),
 2261:     port_expect(Port, Rest, Options);
 2262: port_expect(_, [], _) ->
 2263:     ok.
 2264: 
 2265: %%% Check for either line or {line,N} in option list
 2266: line_option([{line,_}|_]) ->
 2267:     true;
 2268: line_option([line|_]) ->
 2269:     true;
 2270: line_option([_|T]) ->
 2271:     line_option(T);
 2272: line_option([]) ->
 2273:     false.
 2274: 
 2275: any_list_to_binary({Atom, List}) ->
 2276:     {Atom, list_to_binary(List)};
 2277: any_list_to_binary(List) ->
 2278:     list_to_binary(List).
 2279: 
 2280: maybe_to_binary(Expects, true) ->
 2281:     lists:map(fun any_list_to_binary/1, Expects);
 2282: maybe_to_binary(Expects, false) ->
 2283:     Expects.
 2284: 
 2285: port_send(_Port, false) -> ok;
 2286: port_send(Port, Send) when is_list(Send) ->
 2287:     %    io:format("port_send(~p, ~p)", [Port, Send]),
 2288:     Port ! {self(), {command, Send}}.
 2289: 
 2290: receive_all(Port, [Expect|Rest]) ->
 2291:     %    io:format("receive_all(~p, [~p|Rest])", [Port, Expect]),
 2292:     receive
 2293:         {Port, {data, Expect}} ->
 2294:             io:format("Received ~s", [format(Expect)]),
 2295:             ok;
 2296:         {Port, {data, Other}} ->
 2297:             io:format("Received ~s; expected ~s",
 2298:                       [format(Other), format(Expect)]),
 2299:             ct:fail(bad_message);
 2300:         Other ->
 2301:             %% (We're not yet prepared for receiving both 'eol' and
 2302:             %% 'exit_status'; remember that they may appear in any order.)
 2303:             case {Expect, Rest, Other} of
 2304:                 {eof, [], {Port, eof}} ->
 2305:                     io:format("Received soft EOF.",[]),
 2306:                     ok;
 2307:                 {{exit_status, S}, [], {Port, {exit_status, S}}} ->
 2308:                     io:format("Received exit status ~p.",[S]),
 2309:                     ok;
 2310:                 _ ->
 2311:                     %%%	            io:format("Unexpected message: ~s", [format(Other)]),
 2312:                     io:format("Unexpected message: ~w", [Other]),
 2313:                     ct:fail(unexpected_message)
 2314:             end
 2315:     end,
 2316:     receive_all(Port, Rest);
 2317: receive_all(_Port, []) ->
 2318:     ok.
 2319: 
 2320: stream_receive_all(Port, [Expect]) ->
 2321:     stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect).
 2322: 
 2323: stream_receive_all1(_Port, Empty) when is_binary(Empty), size(Empty) == 0 ->
 2324:     ok;
 2325: stream_receive_all1(_Port, []) ->
 2326:     ok;
 2327: stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect) ->
 2328:     receive
 2329:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 2330:             Remaining = compare(Data, Expect),
 2331:             stream_receive_all1(Port, Remaining);
 2332:         Other ->
 2333:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
 2334:     end.
 2335: 
 2336: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2), byte_size(B1) =< byte_size(B2) ->
 2337:     case split_binary(B2, size(B1)) of
 2338:         {B1,Remaining} ->
 2339:             Remaining;
 2340:         _Other ->
 2341:             ct:fail(nomatch)
 2342:     end;
 2343: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2) ->
 2344:     ct:fail(too_much_data);
 2345: compare([X|Rest1], [X|Rest2]) ->
 2346:     compare(Rest1, Rest2);
 2347: compare([_|_], [_|_]) ->
 2348:     ct:fail(nomatch);
 2349: compare([], Remaining) ->
 2350:     Remaining;
 2351: compare(_Data, []) ->
 2352:     ct:fail(too_much_data).
 2353: 
 2354: maybe_to_list(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2355:     binary_to_list(Bin);
 2356: maybe_to_list(List) ->
 2357:     List.
 2358: 
 2359: format({Eol,List}) ->
 2360:     io_lib:format("tuple<~w,~w>",[Eol, maybe_to_list(List)]);
 2361: format(List) when is_list(List) ->
 2362:     case list_at_least(50, List) of
 2363:         true ->
 2364:             io_lib:format("\"~-50s...\"", [List]);
 2365:         false ->
 2366:             io_lib:format("~p", [List])
 2367:     end;
 2368: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) >= 50 ->
 2369:     io_lib:format("binary<~-50s...>", [binary_to_list(Bin, 1, 50)]);
 2370: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2371:     io_lib:format("binary<~s>", [binary_to_list(Bin)]).
 2372: 
 2373: 
 2374: list_at_least(Number, [_|Rest]) when Number > 0 ->
 2375:     list_at_least(Number-1, Rest);
 2376: list_at_least(Number, []) when Number > 0 ->
 2377:     false;
 2378: list_at_least(0, _List) -> true.
 2379: 
 2380: 
 2381: %%% Utility functions.
 2382: 
 2383: random_packet(Size) ->
 2384:     random_packet(Size, "").
 2385: 
 2386: random_packet(Size, Prefix) ->
 2387:     build_packet(Size-length(Prefix), lists:reverse(Prefix), random_char()).
 2388: 
 2389: build_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
 2390:     lists:reverse(Result);
 2391: build_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
 2392:     NextChar =
 2393:     if
 2394:         NextChar0 >= 126 ->
 2395:             33;
 2396:         true ->
 2397:             NextChar0+1
 2398:     end,
 2399:     build_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
 2400: 
 2401: sizes() ->
 2402:     [10, 13, 64, 127, 128, 255, 256, 1023, 1024,
 2403:      32767, 32768, 65535, 65536].
 2404: 
 2405: sizes(Header_Size) ->
 2406:     sizes(Header_Size, sizes(), []).
 2407: 
 2408: sizes(1, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 256 ->
 2409:     sizes(1, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2410: sizes(2, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 65536 ->
 2411:     sizes(2, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2412: sizes(4, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) ->
 2413:     sizes(4, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2414: sizes(_, _, Result) ->
 2415:     Result.
 2416: 
 2417: random_char() ->
 2418:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
 2419: 
 2420: random_char(Chars) ->
 2421:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
 2422: 
 2423: uniform(N) ->
 2424:     case rand:export_seed() of
 2425:         undefined ->
 2426:             rand:seed(exsplus),
 2427:             io:format("Random seed = ~p\n", [rand:export_seed()]);
 2428:         _ ->
 2429:             ok
 2430:     end,
 2431:     rand:uniform(N).
 2432: 
 2433: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2434:     fun_spawn(Fun, []).
 2435: 
 2436: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2437:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2438: 
 2439: port_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2440:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "port_test").
 2441: 
 2442: %% Test that erlang:ports/0 returns a consistent snapshot of ports
 2443: ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2444:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2445:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 2446: 
 2447:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, % Wait for other ports to stabilize
 2448: 
 2449:     OtherPorts = erlang:ports(),
 2450:     io:format("Other ports: ~p\n",[OtherPorts]),
 2451:     MaxPorts = 1024 - length(OtherPorts),
 2452: 
 2453:     TrafficPid = spawn_link(fun() -> ports_traffic(MaxPorts) end),
 2454: 
 2455:     ports_snapshots(100, TrafficPid, OtherPorts),
 2456:     TrafficPid ! {self(),die},
 2457:     receive {TrafficPid, dead} -> ok end,
 2458:     ok.
 2459: 
 2460: ports_snapshots(0, _, _) ->
 2461:     ok;
 2462: ports_snapshots(Iter, TrafficPid, OtherPorts) ->
 2463: 
 2464:     TrafficPid ! start,
 2465:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2466: 
 2467:     Snapshot = erlang:ports(),
 2468: 
 2469:     TrafficPid ! {self(), stop},
 2470:     receive {TrafficPid, EventList, TrafficPorts} -> ok end,
 2471: 
 2472:     %%io:format("Snapshot=~p\n", [Snapshot]),
 2473:     ports_verify(Snapshot, OtherPorts ++ TrafficPorts, EventList),
 2474: 
 2475:     ports_snapshots(Iter-1, TrafficPid, OtherPorts).
 2476: 
 2477: 
 2478: ports_traffic(MaxPorts) ->
 2479:     ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {[],0}).
 2480: 
 2481: ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}) ->
 2482:     receive
 2483:         start ->
 2484:             %%io:format("Traffic started in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2485:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, []);
 2486:         {Pid,die} ->
 2487:             lists:foreach(fun(Port)-> erlang:port_close(Port) end,
 2488:                           PortList),
 2489:             Pid ! {self(),dead}
 2490:     end.
 2491: 
 2492: ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2493:     receive
 2494:         {Pid, stop} ->
 2495:             %%io:format("Traffic stopped in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2496:             Pid ! {self(), EventList, PortList},
 2497:             ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt})
 2498: 
 2499:     after 0 ->
 2500:               ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList)
 2501:     end.
 2502: 
 2503: ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2504:     N = uniform(MaxPorts),
 2505:     case N > PortCnt of
 2506:         true -> % Open port
 2507:             P = open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 2508:             %%io:format("Created port ~p\n",[P]),
 2509:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {[P|PortList], PortCnt+1},
 2510:                                   [{open,P}|EventList]);
 2511: 
 2512:         false -> % Close port
 2513:             P = lists:nth(N, PortList),
 2514:             %%io:format("Close port ~p\n",[P]),
 2515:             true = erlang:port_close(P),
 2516:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {lists:delete(P,PortList), PortCnt-1},
 2517:                                   [{close,P}|EventList])
 2518:     end.
 2519: 
 2520: ports_verify(Ports, PortsAfter, EventList) ->
 2521:     %%io:format("Candidate=~p\nEvents=~p\n", [PortsAfter, EventList]),
 2522:     case lists:sort(Ports) =:= lists:sort(PortsAfter) of
 2523:         true ->
 2524:             io:format("Snapshot of ~p ports verified ok.\n",[length(Ports)]),
 2525:             ok;
 2526:         false ->
 2527:             %% Note that we track the event list "backwards", undoing open/close:
 2528:             case EventList of
 2529:                 [{open,P} | Tail] ->
 2530:                     ports_verify(Ports, lists:delete(P,PortsAfter), Tail);
 2531: 
 2532:                 [{close,P} | Tail] ->
 2533:                     ports_verify(Ports, [P | PortsAfter], Tail);
 2534: 
 2535:                 [] ->
 2536:                     ct:fail("Inconsistent snapshot from erlang:ports()")
 2537:             end
 2538:     end.
 2539: 
 2540: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2541:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2542:         ok -> ok;
 2543:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2544:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2545:             Res
 2546:     end.
 2547: 
 2548: 
 2549: %% Send data to port program that does not read it, then close port.
 2550: %% Primary targeting Windows to test threaded_handle_closer in sys.c
 2551: close_deaf_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2552:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 2553:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2554:     DeadPort = os:find_executable("dead_port", DataDir),
 2555:     Port = open_port({spawn,DeadPort++" 60"},[]),
 2556:     erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2557:     port_close(Port),
 2558: 
 2559:     Res = close_deaf_port_1(0, DeadPort),
 2560:     io:format("Waiting for OS procs to terminate...\n"),
 2561:     receive after 5*1000 -> ok end,
 2562:     Res.
 2563: 
 2564: close_deaf_port_1(200, _) ->
 2565:     ok;
 2566: close_deaf_port_1(N, Cmd) ->
 2567:     Timeout = integer_to_list(rand:uniform(5*1000)),
 2568:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Cmd},[{args,[Timeout]}]) of
 2569:         Port ->
 2570:             erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2571:             port_close(Port),
 2572:             close_deaf_port_1(N+1, Cmd)
 2573:     catch
 2574:         _:eagain ->
 2575:             {comment, "Could not spawn more than " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ " OS processes."}
 2576:     end.
 2577: 
 2578: %% Test undocumented port_set_data/2 and port_get_data/1
 2579: %% Hammer from multiple processes a while
 2580: %% and then abrubtly close the port (OTP-12208).
 2581: port_setget_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2582:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "echo_drv"),
 2583:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 2584: 
 2585:     NSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2586:     HeapData = {1,2,3,<<"A heap binary">>,fun()->"This is fun"end,
 2587:                 list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,100))},
 2588:     PRs = lists:map(fun(I) ->
 2589:                             spawn_opt(fun() -> port_setget_data_hammer(Port,HeapData,false,1) end,
 2590:                                       [monitor, {scheduler, I rem NSched}])
 2591:                     end,
 2592:                     lists:seq(1,10)),
 2593:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2594:     Papa = self(),
 2595:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) -> Pid ! {Papa,prepare_for_close} end, PRs),
 2596:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) ->
 2597:                           receive {Pid,prepare_for_close} -> ok end
 2598:                   end,
 2599:                   PRs),
 2600:     port_close(Port),
 2601:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,Ref}) ->
 2602:                           receive {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end
 2603:                   end,
 2604:                   PRs),
 2605:     ok.
 2606: 
 2607: port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet0, N) ->
 2608:     Rand = rand:uniform(3),
 2609:     IsSet1 = try case Rand of
 2610:                      1 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, atom), true;
 2611:                      2 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, HeapData), true;
 2612:                      3 -> case erlang:port_get_data(Port) of
 2613:                               atom -> true;
 2614:                               HeapData -> true;
 2615:                               undefined -> false=IsSet0
 2616:                           end
 2617:                  end
 2618:              catch
 2619:                  error:badarg ->
 2620:                      true = get(prepare_for_close),
 2621:                      io:format("~p did ~p rounds before port closed\n", [self(), N]),
 2622:                      exit(normal)
 2623:              end,
 2624:     receive {Papa, prepare_for_close} ->
 2625:                 put(prepare_for_close, true),
 2626:                 Papa ! {self(),prepare_for_close}
 2627:     after 0 ->
 2628:               ok
 2629:     end,
 2630:     port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet1, N+1).
 2631: 
 2632: 
 2633: wait_until(Fun) ->
 2634:     case catch Fun() of
 2635:         true ->
 2636:             ok;
 2637:         _ ->
 2638:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2639:             wait_until(Fun)
 2640:     end.
 2641: 
 2642: %% Attempt to monitor pid as port, and port as pid
 2643: mon_port_invalid_type(_Config) ->
 2644:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
 2645:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, self())),
 2646:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(process, Port)),
 2647:     ok.
 2648: 
 2649: %% With local port
 2650: mon_port_local(Config) ->
 2651:     Port1 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2652:     Ref1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2653:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2654:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2655:     Port1 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2656:     receive ExitP1 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref1, port, Port1, _}, ExitP1)
 2657:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2658:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2659:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2660: 
 2661:     %% Trying to re-monitor a port which exists but is not healthy will
 2662:     %% succeed but then will immediately send DOWN
 2663:     Ref2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2664:     receive ExitP2 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref2, port, Port1, _}, ExitP2)
 2665:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2666:     ok.
 2667: 
 2668: %% With remote port on remote node (should fail)
 2669: mon_port_remote_on_remote(_Config) ->
 2670:     Port3 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2671:                              100, 0, 13, "fgsfds@fgsfds", % Node :: ATOM_EXT
 2672:                              1:32/big,          % Id
 2673:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2674:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port3)),
 2675:     ok.
 2676: 
 2677: %% Remote port belongs to this node and does not exist
 2678: %% Port4 produces #Port<0.167772160> which should not exist in a test run
 2679: mon_port_bad_remote_on_local(_Config) ->
 2680:     Port4 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2681:                              100, 0, 13, "nonode@nohost", % Node
 2682:                              167772160:32/big,  % Id
 2683:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2684:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port4)),
 2685:     ok.
 2686: 
 2687: %% Monitor owner (origin) dies before port is closed
 2688: mon_port_origin_dies(Config) ->
 2689:     Port5 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2690:     Self5 = self(),
 2691:     Proc5 = spawn(fun() ->
 2692:                       Self5 ! test5_started,
 2693:                       erlang:monitor(port, Port5),
 2694:                       receive stop -> ok end
 2695:                   end),
 2696:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc5), % we want to sync with its death
 2697:     receive test5_started -> ok
 2698:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2699:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2700:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2701:     Proc5 ! stop,
 2702:     % receive from monitor (removing race condition)
 2703:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc5, _}, ExitP5)
 2704:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2705:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2706:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2707:     Port5 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % make port quit
 2708:     ok.
 2709: 
 2710: %% Port and Monitor owner dies before port is closed
 2711: %% This testcase checks for a regression memory leak in erts
 2712: %% when the controlling and monitoring process is the same process
 2713: %% and the process dies
 2714: mon_port_owner_dies(Config) ->
 2715:     Self = self(),
 2716:     Proc = spawn(fun() ->
 2717:                          Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]),
 2718:                          Self ! {test_started, Port},
 2719:                          erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2720:                          receive stop -> ok end
 2721:                   end),
 2722:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc), % we want to sync with its death
 2723:     Port = receive {test_started,P} -> P
 2724:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2725:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2726:                  port_is_monitored(Proc, Port)),
 2727:     Proc ! stop,
 2728:     %% receive from monitor
 2729:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc, _}, ExitP5)
 2730:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2731:     ok.
 2732: 
 2733: %% Monitor a named port
 2734: mon_port_named(Config) ->
 2735:     Name6 = test_port6,
 2736:     Port6 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2737:     erlang:register(Name6, Port6),
 2738:     erlang:monitor(port, Name6),
 2739:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2740:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2741:     Port6 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2742:     receive ExitP6 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, port, {Name6, _}, _}, ExitP6)
 2743:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2744:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2745:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2746:     ok.
 2747: 
 2748: %% Named does not exist: Should succeed but immediately send 'DOWN'
 2749: mon_port_bad_named(_Config) ->
 2750:     Name7 = test_port7,
 2751:     erlang:monitor(port, Name7),
 2752:     receive {'DOWN', _, port, {Name7, _}, noproc} -> ok
 2753:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2754:     ok.
 2755: 
 2756: %% Monitor a pid and demonitor by ref
 2757: mon_port_pid_demonitor(Config) ->
 2758:     Port8 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2759:     Ref8 = erlang:monitor(port, Port8),
 2760:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2761:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2762:     erlang:demonitor(Ref8),
 2763:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2764:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2765:     Port8 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2766:     ok.
 2767: 
 2768: %% Monitor by name and demonitor by ref
 2769: mon_port_name_demonitor(Config) ->
 2770:     Name9 = test_port9,
 2771:     Port9 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2772:     erlang:register(Name9, Port9),
 2773:     Ref9 = erlang:monitor(port, Name9),
 2774:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2775:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2776:     erlang:demonitor(Ref9),
 2777:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2778:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2779:     Port9 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2780:     ok.
 2781: 
 2782: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2783: %% 2. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2784: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2785: %% 3. While the command happens, a monitor is requested on the port
 2786: mon_port_driver_die(Config) ->
 2787:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2788: 
 2789:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2790:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2791:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2792: 
 2793:     Self = self(),
 2794:     erlang:spawn_opt(fun() ->
 2795:                              timer:sleep(250),
 2796:                              Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2797:                              %% Now check that msg actually arrives
 2798:                              receive
 2799:                                  {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2800:                              after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2801:                              end
 2802:                      end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2803:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2804:     receive
 2805:         A when is_atom(A) -> ?assertEqual(A, 'A_should_be_printed');
 2806:         {'DOWN', _R, port, Port, noproc} -> ok;
 2807:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2808:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2809:     end,
 2810:     ok.
 2811: 
 2812: -ifdef(DISABLED_TESTCASE).
 2813: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2814: %% 2. Monitor port
 2815: %% 3. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2816: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2817: %% 4. While the command happens, a demonitor is requested on the port
 2818: mon_port_driver_die_demonitor(Config) ->
 2819:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2820: 
 2821:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2822:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2823:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2824: 
 2825:     Self = self(),
 2826:     erlang:spawn_opt(
 2827:       fun() ->
 2828:               Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2829:               Self ! Ref,
 2830:               timer:sleep(250),
 2831:               erlang:demonitor(Ref),
 2832:               %% Now check that msg still arrives,
 2833:               %% the demon should have arrived after
 2834:               %% the port exited
 2835:               receive
 2836:                   {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2837:               after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2838:               end
 2839:       end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2840:     Ref = receive R -> R end,
 2841:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2842:     receive
 2843:         {'DOWN', Ref, port, Port, normal} -> ok;
 2844:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2845:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2846:     end,
 2847:     ok.
 2848: -endif.
 2849: 
 2850: %% @doc Makes a controllable port for testing. Underlying mechanism of this
 2851: %% port is not important, only important is our ability to close/kill it or
 2852: %% have it monitored.
 2853: create_port(Config, Args) ->
 2854:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 2855:     %% Borrow port test utility from port SUITE
 2856:     Program = filename:join([DataDir, "port_test"]),
 2857:     erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Program}, [{args, Args}]).
 2858: 
 2859: %% @doc Checks if process Pid exists, and if so, if its monitoring (or not)
 2860: %% the Port (or if port doesn't exist, we assume answer is no).
 2861: port_is_monitored(Pid, Port) when is_pid(Pid), is_port(Port) ->
 2862:     %% Variant for when port is a port id (port())
 2863:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2864:             undefined -> false;
 2865:             {monitors, ProcMTargets} -> lists:member({port, Port}, ProcMTargets)
 2866:         end,
 2867:     B = case erlang:port_info(Port, monitored_by) of
 2868:             undefined -> false;
 2869:             {monitored_by, PortMonitors} -> lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2870:         end,
 2871:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B};
 2872: port_is_monitored(Pid, PortName) when is_pid(Pid), is_atom(PortName) ->
 2873:     %% Variant for when port is an atom
 2874:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2875:         undefined -> false;
 2876:         {monitors, ProcMTargets} ->
 2877:             lists:member({port, {PortName, node()}}, ProcMTargets)
 2878:     end,
 2879:     B = case erlang:whereis(PortName) of
 2880:             undefined -> false; % name is not registered or is dead
 2881:             PortId ->
 2882:                 case erlang:port_info(PortId, monitored_by) of
 2883:                     undefined -> false; % is dead
 2884:                     {monitored_by, PortMonitors} ->
 2885:                         lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2886:                 end
 2887:         end,
 2888:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B}.
 2889: 
 2890: %%
 2891: %%
 2892: %% Test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 2893: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 2894: %%
 2895: %%
 2896: 
 2897: -record(esrt, {repeat = 1000,
 2898:                owner_sched = 0,
 2899:                prep_owner = fun (Prt) -> Prt end,
 2900:                post_owner = fun (_) -> ok end,
 2901:                send_sched_start = 0,
 2902:                senders = 1,
 2903:                prep_signal = fun (Prt, PrtOwn) -> {Prt, PrtOwn} end,
 2904:                signal,
 2905:                post_signal = fun (_) -> ok end}).
 2906: 
 2907: port_exit_monitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2908:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2909:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PrtOwn}) ->
 2910:                                        {Port, erlang:monitor(port, Port)}
 2911:                                end,
 2912:                       post_signal = fun ({Port, Mon}) ->
 2913:                                             receive
 2914:                                                 {'DOWN', Mon, port, Port, Reason} ->
 2915:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2916:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2917:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2918:                                                     end
 2919:                                             after
 2920:                                                 1000 ->
 2921:                                                     exit(missing_down_message)
 2922:                                             end
 2923:                                     end},
 2924:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2925: 
 2926: port_exit_demonitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2927:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2928:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2929:                                             erlang:monitor(port, Port)
 2930:                                     end,
 2931:                       signal = fun (Mon) ->
 2932:                                        erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush])
 2933:                                end},
 2934:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2935: 
 2936: port_exit_link_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2937:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2938:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2939:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2940:                                             Port
 2941:                                     end,
 2942:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2943:                                        link(Port),
 2944:                                        Port
 2945:                                end,
 2946:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2947:                                             receive
 2948:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2949:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2950:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2951:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2952:                                                     end
 2953:                                             after
 2954:                                                 1000 ->
 2955:                                                     exit(missing_exit_message)
 2956:                                             end
 2957:                                     end},
 2958:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2959: 
 2960: port_exit_unlink_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2961:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2962:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2963:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2964:                                             link(Port),
 2965:                                             Port
 2966:                                     end,
 2967:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2968:                                        unlink(Port),
 2969:                                        Port
 2970:                                end,
 2971:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2972:                                             receive
 2973:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2974:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2975:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2976:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2977:                                                     end
 2978:                                             after
 2979:                                                 0 ->
 2980:                                                     ok
 2981:                                             end
 2982:                                     end},
 2983:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2984: 
 2985: port_exit_command_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2986:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2987:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 2988:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {command, "halloj"}},
 2989:                                        Port
 2990:                                end,
 2991:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2992:                                             receive
 2993:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 2994:                                                     {data, "halloj"} = Data
 2995:                                             after
 2996:                                                 0 ->
 2997:                                                     ok
 2998:                                             end
 2999:                                     end},
 3000:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3001: 
 3002: port_exit_connect_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3003:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3004:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3005:     %% port as itself. The port owner will be spammed by {Port,
 3006:     %% connected} messages but we ignore those...
 3007:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3008:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3009:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {connect, PortOwner}},
 3010:                                        Port
 3011:                                end},
 3012:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3013: 
 3014: 
 3015: port_exit_close_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3016:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3017:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3018:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, close},
 3019:                                        Port
 3020:                                end},
 3021:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3022: 
 3023: port_exit_exit_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3024:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3025:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3026:                                        exit(Port, normal)
 3027:                                end},
 3028:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3029: 
 3030: port_exit_command_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3031:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3032:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3033:                                        true = try
 3034:                                                   erlang:port_command(Port, "hejsan")
 3035:                                               catch
 3036:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3037:                                                       true
 3038:                                               end,
 3039:                                        Port
 3040:                                end,
 3041:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3042:                                             receive
 3043:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3044:                                                     {data, "hejsan"} = Data
 3045:                                             after
 3046:                                                 0 ->
 3047:                                                     ok
 3048:                                             end
 3049:                                     end},
 3050:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3051: 
 3052: port_exit_connect_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3053:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3054:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3055:     %% port as itself.
 3056:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3057:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3058:                                        true = try
 3059:                                                   erlang:port_connect(Port, PortOwner)
 3060:                                               catch
 3061:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3062:                                                       true
 3063:                                               end
 3064:                                end},
 3065:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3066: 
 3067: port_exit_close_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3068:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3069:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3070:                                        true = try
 3071:                                                   erlang:port_close(Port)
 3072:                                               catch
 3073:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3074:                                                       true
 3075:                                               end,
 3076:                                        Port
 3077:                                end},
 3078:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3079: 
 3080: port_exit_control_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3081:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3082:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3083:                                        [] = try
 3084:                                                 erlang:port_control(Port, 0, [])
 3085:                                             catch
 3086:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3087:                                                     []
 3088:                                             end
 3089:                                end},
 3090:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3091: 
 3092: port_exit_call_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3093:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3094:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3095:                                        [] = try
 3096:                                                 erlang:port_call(Port, 0, term_to_binary([]))
 3097:                                             catch
 3098:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3099:                                                     []
 3100:                                             end
 3101:                                end},
 3102:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3103: 
 3104: port_exit_info_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3105:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3106:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3107:                                        case erlang:port_info(Port, connected) of
 3108:                                            {connected, PortOwner} -> ok;
 3109:                                            undefined -> ok;
 3110:                                            Unexpected -> exit({unexpected_info, Unexpected})
 3111:                                        end
 3112:                                end},
 3113:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3114: 
 3115: 
 3116: prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config) ->
 3117:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 3118:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 3119:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 3120:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 3121:         1 ->
 3122:             #esrt{};
 3123:         2 ->
 3124:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3125:                   send_sched_start = 1,
 3126:                   senders = 1};
 3127:         3 ->
 3128:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3129:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3130:                   senders = 1};
 3131:         N ->
 3132:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3133:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3134:                   senders = N - 3}
 3135:     end.
 3136: 
 3137: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{repeat = N} = ESRT) ->
 3138:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, ESRT).
 3139: 
 3140: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(0, #esrt{}) ->
 3141:     ok;
 3142: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, #esrt{} = ESRT) ->
 3143:     port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT),
 3144:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N-1, ESRT).
 3145: 
 3146: port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{owner_sched = OwnSched,
 3147:                                  prep_owner = PrepOwner,
 3148:                                  post_owner = PostOwner,
 3149:                                  send_sched_start = SendSchedStart,
 3150:                                  senders = Senders,
 3151:                                  prep_signal = PrepSignal,
 3152:                                  signal = Signal,
 3153:                                  post_signal = PostSignal}) ->
 3154:     %% Send a close signal to the port simultaneously as another signal
 3155:     %% is sent (from multiple senders). We try to provoke races between
 3156:     %% the port entering an exiting state and handling of the signal. Such
 3157:     %% races have shown themselves as either stray messages to signal
 3158:     %% sender or runtime system crashes.
 3159:     Parent = self(),
 3160:     {PrtOwn,
 3161:      PrtOwnMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3162:                                     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 3163:                                     true = is_port(Prt),
 3164:                                     OwnState = PrepOwner(Prt),
 3165:                                     Prt ! {self(), {command, "hej"}},
 3166:                                     receive
 3167:                                         {Prt, Data} ->
 3168:                                             {data, "hej"} = Data
 3169:                                     end,
 3170:                                     Parent ! {prepared, self(), Prt},
 3171:                                     receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3172:                                     Prt ! {self(), close},
 3173:                                     PostOwner(OwnState)
 3174:                             end,
 3175:                             [link, monitor, {scheduler, OwnSched}]),
 3176:     Port = receive {prepared, PrtOwn, Prt} -> Prt end,
 3177:     PMs = lists:map(fun (SendSched) ->
 3178:                             spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3179:                                               PrtMon = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 3180:                                               SigState1 = PrepSignal(Port, PrtOwn),
 3181:                                               Parent ! {prepared, self()},
 3182:                                               receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3183:                                               SigState2 = Signal(SigState1),
 3184:                                               receive {'DOWN', PrtMon, port, Port, _} -> ok end,
 3185:                                               receive {bye, Parent} -> ok end,
 3186:                                               PostSignal(SigState2),
 3187:                                               receive Msg -> exit({unexpected_msg, Msg})
 3188:                                               after 0 -> ok
 3189:                                               end
 3190:                                       end,
 3191:                                       [link, monitor, {scheduler, SendSched}])
 3192:                     end,
 3193:                     lists:seq(SendSchedStart, SendSchedStart + Senders - 1)), 
 3194:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> receive {prepared, P} -> ok end end, PMs),
 3195:     PrtOwn ! {go, self()},
 3196:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {go, self()} end, PMs),
 3197:     receive
 3198:         {'DOWN', PrtOwnMon, process, PrtOwn, OwnReason} ->
 3199:             normal = OwnReason
 3200:     end,
 3201:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {bye, self()} end, PMs),
 3202:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 3203:                           receive
 3204:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, SigSndReason} ->
 3205:                                   normal = SigSndReason
 3206:                           end
 3207:                   end,
 3208:                   PMs),
 3209:     ok.
 3210: 
 3211: %%
 3212: %%
 3213: %% End of test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 3214: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 3215: %%
 3216: %%
